loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda I. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 32 years old. Rosenda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosenda owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita N. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Carmelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita has a business growing crops, planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Carmelita has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 13,333 PHP a month.

In 1999, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Noraima

texts.en:
Noraima S. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 29 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Noraima recently started a transportation services business, which is her main source of income. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from the business.

In 2008, Noraima joined GDMPC to access their financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. Noraima is requesting 3,000 PHP for her second GDMPC loan, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermongers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita R. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Cristita is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cristita plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Cristita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Cristita's secon loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, pay for her child's tuition, and meet her family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette S. is from the village of Mantic Tangub. She is 40 years old. Bernadette is married. To make a living, Bernadette owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells daily-use products and dried goods in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bernadette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Bernadette's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay K. is 39 years old. A married woman, she lives with her other family members in the city of Phnom Penh, about 5 kilometers from the river. She makes a living by selling a snack food from her home to her neighbors in the village. Her husband earns income by driving a motor taxi (he appears in the picture). This couple has two children who are secondary students. Lay K. will be using this loan to finish repairing her old house and to buy more essential ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To finish repairing her old house and to buy more essential ingredients for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Veronica is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. She use the previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This will be Veronica's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena C. is 11 years older than her husband, Jovanni C., who is now 30 years old. They were blessed with 3 children, John Errol, who is 21 years old, Van Dawelle, who is 8 years old, and Anwka Chloe, who is 3 months old. Her husband works for a family, but his salary, while useful as one source of their income, is not enough to cover their household expenses and their children's tuition.

So Magdalena had to think of another way for them to earn extra income to augment small income of her husband, even though he works hard. She decided to start a fishing business. She and her husband built a fish cage that located in the sea near their house. This business gives them extra income and fits well in their lives.

When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), Magdalena used the loan that she received to start her business. Now she has decided to request another loan. She will use the loan funds to buy supplies for her business, such as bundles of fishnet, different kind of rope, fingerlings, and some bamboo to expand her fish cage.

Magdalena’s hope is that God will give her a long life so that she canhelp her children and grandchildren to cope up with life and give them a better future, especially her youngest child. And she also hopes that, someday, her business bring them success.

loans.use: For additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Lung

texts.en: Lung M. and her family members appear in the photo provided. Lung M., 29, has two young children who are still to young to be enrolled in school. To earn a living, Lung M. retails in the sale of chickens that she buys in bulk from middlemen/poultry famers. She typically generates an income of $5 a day to feed her family. She also relies on the income from her husband's job. He drives a motor taxi. In order to raise more money to support her family’s standard of living, Lung M. has requested a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy piglets to raise in a stall that she has built next to her house.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise in a stall that she built.

loans.name: El

texts.en: El I S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with three children. One of her children is married and has started a new home. The other two children are still living in the family home. Her husband is a local merchandise trader. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who has tried to earn money to feed all her children since they were very young. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish to people who are passers-by in the village. El I S. will be using half of the loan as extra capital to sustain her business growth. With the remainder of the loan she will buy candles, in bulk, to re-sell for profit.

loans.use: To sustain her business growth and to buy candles to sell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina D. V. is now 41 years old and married to Henry D. V. 48 years old. Their two children are John Henry 14 years old now currently studying in high school and Jobert 8 years old now in his primary level. Their main source of income today is their two businesses; the bamboo set making and their fish cage. These businesses runs for 5 years now, it gives them income that they’ll use in their daily expenses in the house and also expenses for the schooling of her two children. Because her husband is a former fisherman and carpenter he manages their business well.

She always use the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in her two businesses like today, she will use it again to buy motor boat for their boat use in visiting their fish cage and bamboo for the making of bamboo set.

Marlina’s dream is that maybe someday she will have their own stall or store place in their public market for selling their bamboo set, so that if this give them more income she is sure that she can send her children to school until college.

loans.use: To finance her bamboo set making business and also her fishing business

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math R. is 28 years old and a resident of the best territory in Phnom Penh, the capital. She currently works sewing clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with one young child, while her husband’s name is Mr. Emron, age 28, who is a sewing machine repairer for the industry.

Math R. and her husband always find it hard commuting to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have their own vehicle for traveling needs. Therefore, Math R. has asked for a loan from Kiva in order to buy a motorcycle which she and her husband will use to ride to their workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 42 years old, married to Rondillo Sr. and they were blessed with four children: Rondillo Jr. - 26 years old, college graduate and married; Roger - 24 years old, is working as a salesman;Catherine, also a college graduate, and their youngest is Cristina - 6 years old, already in grade one.  Her family lives together in Barangay Mabini, Cauayan City, Their place is along the city proper of Cauayan. 

Cynthia manages a retail business of fruits and vegetables just in front of their house for almost three years. She earns a weekly income of PHP2, 500 and it is being budget to provide the basic needs of their family and also as a rolling capital in her business.  Cynthia is now asking for additional business capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP15, 000.  This will be of big help in improving her retailing business by purchasing more goods. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved for them to become successful.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is engaged in selling bamboo (buho), cogon (grass used for thatching roofs), and charcoal. Some of the items that she sells are woven products and she sells them at a retail price. To further improve her business, Erlinda is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to have additional capital to enable her business to grow.

Erlinda lives in Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, a simple and semi-urban area. She is married to Ruben, a truck driver in Cauayan. They do not have their own child so they adopted one.
	
Erlinda’s requested loan will help her improve her current business and will assist her husband in providing for their family needs since they don’t have other sources of income. Her goal in life is to “work hard, be patient, and learn how to wait for the right turn”.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has operated a retail store in their village for almost 14 years, earning a weekly net income of PHP 1,200.00. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from KIVA to purchase some grocery items to sell in her store in order to generate more income for the education of her children.

Marivic and her husband, Mr. Teody M., a tricycle driver and farmer, have three children: Mardel, 14 years of age, in third year high school; Marissa, 12 years of age, in first year high school, and Madeline, 10 years old, a grade 4 pupil. They are living their life in a simple way at San Francisco Alicia, Isabela, a rural area, near the rice farm, four kilometers away from the national highway.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. is a 55-year-old woman from Agusan Del Sur who earns income from rice farming. Like other farmers, she acknowledges her need for financial support. Because her farm is still short of farm inputs, she is requesting a loan of Php6,000 from CEVI to purchase additional inputs so that her crops will grow well. This loan will surely help Gloria in her living.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie has been married to her husband, Arnel, for seven years now. They are blessed with four children, the eldest being fourteen years old. Jessie is thirty-four years old and tills a rice farm for a living. She is thankful her crops are growing healthy and this encourages her to take extra care of her farm. To achieve good harvest, her farm needs inputs. A new member of CEV, Jessie requested for a loan of Php6, 000. This loan will help Jessie and her family to produce good income from the farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: 40-year-old Jocelyn lives with her husband of 21 years and their 2 children.  She owns a 2-hectare rice field from where she sources out her income. She is happy to share that her crops are growing healthy. She aims to achieve good harvest and confesses her farm still needs financial support for additional farm inputs. She requested for a loan of Php6, 000. This is her first time to loan from CEVI.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida S., a 48-year-old married mother of four children she loves taking care of, makes a living growing rice in Agusan Del Sur.  Her rice crops are growing but still need farm inputs, so to ensure a healthy and abundant harvest, she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, of which she is a member.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma P. is 37 years old and is married to Jerry, a farmer. They have two children, Jephanie, a 12 year old grade VI student and 9 years old  Javeric, who is in grade V. Her family lives in San Fabian Echague.

Vilma manages a grocery store in their village. Aside from merchandise, they also sell some feed as an additional source of income. Her husband Jerry works their rice fields and is her partner in managing their grocery. They each have their own responsibilities in their house.  Vilma is thankful because her family is supportive in her business activities. Vilma would like to continue improving their business and is asking for financial support through the kiva lenders. She wants to increase her stocks of products. For this reason, she is requesting PHP5,000 for business expansion and improvement. She hopes that her loan will be profitable so that she could meet the needs of her family most especially the schooling of their two children.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more products for resale

loans.name: Leody

texts.en:
Leody is a diligent farmer. He is 41 years old, married, and has one child. His hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field needs farm inputs. He joined CEVI last September 2009 to obtain its financial services.

Leody thinks CEVI’s program is very helpful to him and his fellow farmers. He requested Php 6,000 to finance his farm.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean K. is an older woman and the married mother of four children, three of whom are married and live separately and the other one attends school.

Mean K. has been engaged in a business weaving fishnets for more than ten years. She saves many pieces of net before selling them. Most of her clients come to buy her finished nets directly at her house.

Mean K. is 53 years old and married to Em Phear who assists her in making nets. Mean K. requests a loan to purchase more raw materials to continue weaving nets.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving nets

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
“Wise use of capital is necessary to achieve success in business and life” said by Elena P.. She is 37 years of age and a married person. She’s living in the village of San Fabian Echague with her husband and two children: Cyver Guillar-5 years of age and the youngest is Julianne Faye-2 years old. This family is happily and peacefully lives in their village.
	Elena is managing a general store business within their village. Her husband is a vendor of rice and her helper in managing their store. They both work hard for their children’s needs. Elena hopes that she could expand her store and buy additional groceries. But sad to say because she have insufficient capital that’s why she would like to borrow to the KIVA lenders additional capital amounting of PHP5,000. This would serve a big help to them most especially to their business expansion.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Noth

texts.en: Noth Y., 27, is a single mother blessed with a lovely young child. Noth Y. was married, but divorced her husband a year ago. She currently lives with her old mother who helps be responsible for family by selling fruits at the market. To earn a living, Noth Y. owns and operates her small business from her home. She sells a variety type of items such as cooking supplies, snack foods, soft drinks, and is earning an average of US$6 profit a day. Noth Y. is looking for a US$1000 loan and will use the half of the loan to improve her current business and the rest to buy equipment to begin a decorating service for neighbor’s wedding parties. Note: Noth Y. was not available at that time, so her older mother is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To improve her current business and the rest to buy equipment to begin a decorating service for neighbor’s wedding parties

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 33-year-old mother of four. She operates an open-air business in Industrial Area Nairobi where she sells food to employees of the industries. She serves chapati (flat bread), ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), rice, beans, green grams (mung beans), meat and fish, among other foods. Lilian is requesting her third loan of Kes 80,000 to add to her stock of wheat flour, cooking fat, cabbage and other cooking ingredients. She hopes to grow her business into a big hotel (restaurant) and start a wholesale shop. On a personal level, she desires to educate her children to university level and to buy her family a home away from the slums. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 26 year old businessman who runs a retail shop in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He sells grocery and household items like sugar, sweets, soda, water, and cooking flour. His business is near a busy road and his customers are his neighbors and other passersby. He has been in this business for seven years and was previously a fruit vendor on the street. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes to expand his business into a small market with a wholesale business and to employ people. He describes himself as merry, honest, and humble.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock to his business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap Y. is a villager in Kaos Nhai village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Aside from this, she is a breeder who breeds cow, pigs and chicken. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow, three piglets and twenty chickens for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Soy Sek, is laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sopheap Y. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow, three piglets and twenty chickens for her breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chank

texts.en: Chank S. was born in 1958 and is the good mother blessed with five children: three are married and live independently, while other two are sill living in home and are dependent on her income. She sells firewood and charcoal to local people, as many of them need it to cook their foods. She began her business in 1980 and she earns around 15,000 riel a day to feed her family. While her business is doing well, he always takes time to buy more produces during the part of stock supply has been exhausted. Chank S. has asked for a loan in order to better sustain her stable business. She and her daughter are pictured over.

loans.use: To better sustain her stable business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 44 years old and she is married to Cesar, a carpenter. This couple is blessed with a daughter named Quinnie who is 21 years old. The family is happily living in the village of San Fabian Echague.

Leticia hopes for the success of her business. She sells vegetables and at the same time she manages a carinderia or canteen. Developing her carinderia is what she wants to do in order to encourage more costumers to go to her place. In this regard, she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000. She hopes that she will be able to obtain the loan which will help her in buying additional vegetables and ingredients. Some of it will be used in developing her carinderia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell and to develop her carinderia

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
45-year-old Teodora C. has a fishing business in Danao, Panglao. She has six children and the eldest is 27 years old. She needs additional capital to sustain her business.

Teodora joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy materials for her fishing business. This will help her a lot to rise from her difficulties in living.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard O. is a 32-year-old married father of three who runs an electronics and video shop in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He sells TVs, DVDs, CDs, radios, and other electronics and has been in this business for three years. He has two employees and his customers come from the neighborhood and from afar. He also works as an electrician to earn extra income. Bernard is requesting a loan of Kes 80,000 to increase his inventory. He describes himself as a reasonable and hardworking leader and hopes to have a bigger shop to provide a better life for his family. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of electronics

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. is currently in the business of selling cake for kids from her home. She is 31 years old and is married with three children and her children go to school.

Lay K.’s husband has been a local construction foreman for years. He now needs more capital to purchase more heavy construction materials for his business. Therefore, Lay K. decided to seek a loan which will allow her husband to order his material.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more heavy construction materials

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Ek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov E. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members in Ba Khong Khang Lech village in Takeo province. She is a breeder who raises pig and she also is a farmer. Since breeding pig is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Vai, is a laborer who can earn a little money to support the family. Mrs. Pov E. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

Four members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding.

loans.name: 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Tỵ N. Thị (24) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Tỵ is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn (02.09.1.3).


Tỵ is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Tỵ owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Tỵ has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tỵ is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is now requesting a new loan of 3.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tỵ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. Thị Đào (25) is a 57 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  N. Thị Hòa (26) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Lê Thị Mai (27) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nhữ Thị Hương (28) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


5.  Lê Thị T. Linh (29) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tỵ N. Thị (24) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Tỵ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn (02.09.1.3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tỵ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tỵ kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Tỵ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tỵ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về N.ng Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. Thị Đào (25) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. Thị Hòa (26) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Lê Thị Mai (27) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nhữ Thị Hương (28) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  Lê Thị T. Linh (29) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho N.ng người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na Some is a villager in Chan Teab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this, she is a breeder who raises cow and pigs. Since breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow and four piglets and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to support her pig. Her husband, Mr. Yoem Sam Art, is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Na Some is 40 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are employed in a garment factory while others two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of a year.  Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow and four piglets and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to support her pig.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C. has been selling firewood for more than 10 years, has been married Mr. Sokhum Chea, is a fisherman since 1983. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three children. One of them was married and lives in separated home. 

Besides of selling firewood, Srey also started new silk weaving business to earn more extra income. She is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Mr. Oeurn San Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen people is located in Ta Sman village in Takeo province. Mr. Oeurn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this farming, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough moN. to buy fertilizers to support the field so he decided to buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive and he also use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Teav Chantha, helps him on the farming. Mr. Oeurn S. is 25 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of a year. 

All the members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun T., age 43, and his wife, Mrs. Onn Bou, age 46, were married in 1988 and have five children: one daughter and four sons. Two of their children are in school and the other three are wooden-house builders. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Oeun's wife is pictured in the photo. 

Oeun has been a wooden-house constructor for five years, while his wife stays at home to take care of their children and do housework. Their main source of income is only from his business. Oeun doesn’t have enough materials and wants to purchase more crane materials for operating the business, which is why he is asking for his first loan of $300. 

For their future plans, the couple hopes to support their children’s further education.

loans.use: To purchase crane materials for his wooden-house construction business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap P. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a second clothes seller. In this business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more clothes to resell to earn more income. She is 49 years old widow with three children, one of whom is perfume seller while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more clothes to resell to earn more income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married lady. She is 43 years old with two children. She has been in the transport business for a period of about one year.  Beth has never borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend.

Beth hopes to have a fleet of taxi cabs so that she can also operate in the car rental space. This will increase her profit margins and will in turn provide for an improved standard of living. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase another taxi cab

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mr. Norn Y. is a villager in Trapaing Khlout village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Khuong Mun, is a grocer. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family living. In order to improve the family living, Mr. Norn Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a car and be a taxi driver. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a car to be a taxi driver.

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Pork S. is 25 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh Capital, where she earns a living raising poultry in a cage behind her house. She raises chicken and ducks for eggs and slaughtering. She also sells her matured poultry in bulk to a middle trader, who then takes it to re sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married with two young children. Her husband’s name is Choun Kna (pictured) who works with her in the business and also works in construction. Pork S. has applied for a $1000 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to repair her old house that is often infiltrated by water during the coming heavy rains season.

loans.use: To repair her old house that is often infiltrated by water during the coming heavy rains season

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U., 38, and her husband, Mr. Chanthoeun Noy, have been married since 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters works in Phnom Penh, one child is a fisherman and another is a construction worker. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old. In the past, she used to weave for her neighbors for a fee but now she runs her own business. Her husband is a silk weaver and fisherman as well.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Samoeun C. is a villager in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saem Voeun, is a salt middleman. In this business, he needs a motorbike to transport the salts. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Samoeun C. decided to ask for a loan to support this purpose. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the salts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Cette s’est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes de qualité, en particulier les basins du Mali. Elle exerce ce commerce dans sa maison située dans le quartier d’Agoè - Sorad à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi, mais le couple n’a aucun enfant. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2000. Beaucoup de clients font confiance dans la qualité de ses pagnes ; elle commande en effet ses pagnes du Mali, car ils sont faits dans des tissus de qualité. Des femmes revendeuses ambulantes de basins viennent s’approvisionner le plus souvent chez elle. Actuellement elle est presque en rupture de stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 35 pièces de basins.

loans.use: Achat de basins de qualité

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des fertilisants et effectuer le labour

loans.name: Peter Oduor

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children.His business is located within Huruma in the town of Eldoret.

Peter was introduced to KADET by an advertisement in Church.Peter plans to use the loan he is receiving from KADET to add more stock to his baker, including: flour,charcoal and cooking fat.His dreams are to improve his business which he is currently operating in a mabati kiosk. With his profits, Peter intends to support his family in meeting their basic needs.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: For supplies for his bakery: flour, charcoal and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., 25 and her husband, Mr. Phally Heng, 27, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and 1 daughter. One of them attends school and other one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap has been a weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Beatrice Nekesa

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and is operating a retail business at Seregeya centre. Her kiosk's name is World Turning. 

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan she is receiving from KADET, she intends to add more stock to her kiosk. In the future she intends to grow her retail business and buy a plot of land.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock to her shop.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat C., age 46 and her husband, Suy Hour live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have one son who attends school. 

Sarat has been selling fruit (mango) for 10 years. She buys them from villagers and resells them in other districts.  Her husband sells grocery items from home.  Sarat is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase mangos.

loans.use: Purchase mango for resale.

loans.name: Sovannara

texts.en: Mrs. Sovannara S. is a villager in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a Cocky maker. Her husband, Mr. Hin Bros, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a duck egg middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more duck eggs to resell to earn more income. Thus, Mrs. Sovannara S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of who is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat I. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Cheam Roeun, is a salt middleman. Although his business is goI. well, he faces an obstacle because he does not have a motorbike to transport his goods. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sat I. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savI. to buy a motorbike to transport the salts to sell. She is 50 years old and the mother of children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her saving to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente de boisson alcoolisée locale dénommée « sodabi » ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1999 dans le quartier d’Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle s’approvisionne à Tsévié, ville située à quelques kilomètres de Lomé, ville qui possède l’une des meilleures boissons locales du pays. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient énormément la qualité de sa boisson. Actuellement elle souhaite lancer une nouvelle commande ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 bidons de 25 litres de sodabi.
texts.en:
This woman is specialized in the sale of the local alcoholic drink called "sodabi". She started her business in 1999 in the neighborhood of Agoè Démakpoè in Lomé. She is married and the mother of 2 children. This business enables her to contribute ot her family's financial needs.

She supplies herself in Tsévié, a city located some kilometers from Lomé, which has one of the best local drinks in the country. Many of her customers appreciate enormously the quality of her drink. Currently, she wants to order more supplies; for this reason, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES in order to buy 20 twenty-five liter cans of "sodabi".

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Srey No

texts.en: Mrs. Srey No D. lives in Sam Nor Khmao village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Deab Soung, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srey No D. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy U., 42, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Vun, 45, live lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. They have two sons and two daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and other two are in school. The couple has been married since 1988.

Mrs. Chanthy U. is a tailor. Her husband has been raising cows for 10 years. She doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for traveling costs very often. Therefore, she is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn V. is a villager in Proeus Leu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a general goods seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to resell to earn more income for her living. Mrs. Lorn V. is 55 years old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more goods to resell to earn more income for her living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soil additives and fertilizer

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny P. is 47 years old and she lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Neang Ngouk, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Ny P. is requesting a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living. This couple has a child who is laborer. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food for breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kayaka

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire et qui n’a plus aucun enfant à sa charge ; c’est pour pouvoir se prendre en charge et subvenir à ses besoins de base qu’il s’est lancé l’année dernière dans la vente de cartes de recharge cellulaires dans une boutique qu’il a loué dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Il réalise ces temps-ci de bonnes affaires, mais étant en rupture de stocks en ce moment il sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharge cellulaires Togocel et Illico en nombre considérable.

loans.use: Achat de cartes de recharge cellulaires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la coiffure ; elle est mariée à un électricien bâtiment et le couple a un enfant à sa charge. Elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure en 2000 dans le quartier de Gbossimé à Lomé. Elle dispose de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de sont travail. Elle en profite aussi pour vendre des mèches et tissages. Actuellement elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Outré, 50 mèches Ondulé, des tissages et des produits cosmétiques de toute sorte. Elle a une longue expérience sur laquelle elle compte pour rembourser son crédit dans les délais exigés.

loans.use: Achat de mèches, tissages et produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a new member of CEV. She is grateful she qualified to be a member because she said its financial service really helped her living. Linda is 47 years old, a widow and has 7 children. She is into rice farming. Linda aims to have a good harvest that’s why she loaned from CEV with the amount of Php6, 000. This loan could help Linda reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
23-year-old Leah R. is a young mother to 2 children. She has been married to her husband, Julio, for 5 years already. Leah owns a rice farm. Her crops are starting to grow now but she said insects also started to inhabit on her farm. This gives difficulty to Leah’s farming.

She heard of CEV and its good feedback from neighbor barangays and was more than glad to qualify as a member last September 2009. She requested to loan Php6, 000. Leah will use this loan to finance her farm and hopefully get rid of the insects and have a good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Mejelinda

texts.en: Mrs. Mejelinda F. is a 43-year-old diligent farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has no children. She tills her 2-hectare rice field. Her rice crops are starting to grow now but still needs additional farm inputs. Mejelinda was glad she joined CEV because her need for financial assistance can now be met. Other than that, she appreciates its low interest rate. She requested to loan Php6, 000, which she will to finance for her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. sells smoked fish at Elmina near Ankanfu.  Theresa has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a trader. Theresa has been selling since 1998. She supports the husband in the paying of bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to smoke by way of processing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.
To smoke her fish, she goes to the sea shore to buy fresh fish form the sea men. She comes home with the fishes cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally make oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to smoke by way of processing.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, 49, is rice farmer.  Her crop is starting to grow and she needs to ensure a good harvest.  She requests a loan of Php 6,000 for farm inputs, like fertilizer.  Eugenia is a new member of CEV and is thankful for a loan opportunity.

loans.use: Enhance harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Constituer un stock important de Charbons de bois

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is single and he has received senior high educational background.  Clement sells locally made pans for moulding cement, metal stand for oranges and coal pot at Elmina near Ankanful which he has been doing since 2004.   Clement uses his income in the payment of utility bills and apartment.  Clement will use the loan to buy more metal plate for his coal pot, cement mould and orange stand. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clement plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: Clement will use the loan to buy more metal plate for his coal pot, cement mould and orange stand.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is married and has five dependants. She has received junior high school education.  Margaret sells maize, at Elmina near Ankanfu, which she has doing since 1993. Her husband is a driver and she was out of stock when she was visited. These are some of the sacks she used in selling her maize. Margaret uses her income to support the husband in the paying of bills and school fees.  Margaret will use the loan to purchase more maize for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save to build her own house.

loans.use: Margaret will use the loan to purchase more maize for sale.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Phearum P., 28, has been married since 2007 and has a young son. He lives with his wife and mother in a small village along national road number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His mother is a farmer; she grows vegetables and flowers. 

Phearum has been raising pigs for two years. His wife stays at home to take care of their son. She used to be a garment factory worker.  He hopes his business will do well, so he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: Purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Wonderful Group

texts.en:
"Wonderful" is a group of five borrowers led by Anita D., 33, a single mother of three children ages 8-14, third through seventh grade.  Anita is an eleventh grade drop out due to poverty.  She lives in New Kru Town, a crowded and poor community that is full of crime.  Anita works in the Dualla market, where farmers bring their goods from out of town to sell, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Anita sells meat and spear ribs in the Dualla market and has been in this business for five years.  She hopes to become an international business woman.

When she started, her initial capital was Ld$2000.00.   Anita sells quality products so customer are encouraged to come back and buy from her.  She needs this loan to purchase more meat to serve customers.  Anita dreams of building a house for her family so they can move out of New Kru Town.

loans.use: Purchase meat to serve customers.

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Phirum C. and his wife, Sokha Kong, were married in 1994 and have three sons and one daughter. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

They are farmers, growing many types of vegetables for over eight years. They sell their produce in their village and sometimes transport it to the Phnom Penh market.

The C. family depends on farming income, so Phirum requests a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to continue in business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mao Srun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people and they all live in Thnal Teaksen village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Mao S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a chicken breeder. In this poultry business, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to build the chicken cage. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Srey Mao S. is 37 years old widow with two children, one of whom is a seller while another is attending the local school. 
Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build the chicken cage.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim H., age 34, has been married to Mr. Nat Chea, age 35, since 1985. They have three sons and all of them are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thim has been selling porridge in her village since 2006. Her husband has been hired in producing Khmer noodles since 2008. She is requesting her first loan of $500 in order to build a store for selling porridge.

loans.use: To build a store for selling porridge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and enlarge her growing area

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
. Srun C., age 27 and her husband, Mr. Soben Sum, age 26, live in a small village along National Road Number four about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have 2 children: one son and one daughter. 
 
Mrs. Srun C. used to be a garment factory worker, but she stopped the business because just gave a birth. Her husband has been operating grocery store for one year. He buys grocery items from Chompou Van market approximately 3 kilometers from his house for resale and his home.

Srun is applying for her first loan of $200 in order to help capital her husband for buying additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To help capital her husband for purchasing additional grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 25-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children.

Hicham has been working as a furniture repairer for over twenty years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new thread colors and new designs.

Hicham has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him diversify his merchandise and enabled him to always have new designs to offer.

Hicham is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is known for his good work. His clients are mainly people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience and he also wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by enlarging his factory.

loans.use: To purchase new thread colors and new designs

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 34 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband. Hanadi has been working as a sewer since 1996. Hanadi requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Hanadi is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Hanadi decided on doing her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income, as well as she already rents a shop for her own. In the future, she plans on improving her business and buying her shop.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work.

loans.name: Mrs. Hon Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who are all living in Ta Sman village in Takeo province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Hon O. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Kaem Lounh, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Hon O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and she would use the rest of money to buy a battery for her family. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a mirror cutter while the others two are sellers and the others are attending the local school. 
All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Sithat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithat M. and her husband, Mr. Yat Choen, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married since 2000 and have two sons, who are adding school. 

Sithat is a silk weaver. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaving as well. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then in turns them to sell in market located in Phnom Penh. Weaving is a main source of income for supporting Sithat’s family that’s why she is requesting another loan a gain of $500 to purchase silk material for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies of oil and beans

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad owns a hairdressing salon for women and men. He is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Mhammad knows how to treat his clients, who are his friends, neighbors and others. He didn’t face difficulties starting his business. He decided on this work to use his experience and because he wanted to work independently.

Mhammad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and continue his shop décor arrangements. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and continue his shop décor arrangements

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn K. lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer noodle maker. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Pith, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and do the plowing. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Hoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are drivers while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and for plowing.

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoun K., aged 30 and his wife, Mrs. Many Sieng, aged 28, live on an island on the MeK. River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have one son, who is in a local school. 

Thoun and his wife are garment factory workers. Besides this, his wife is also a hairdresser. But, she does not have enough materials for operating her business, so Thou is requesting his first loan of $300 in order to purchase materials for his wife’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his wife’s hairdressing business.

loans.name: Thanaa

texts.en:
Thanaa is a 52 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Thanaa has been selling clothes from her house for the past twelve years. She sells womens, mens and childrens clothes; she sells depending on her clients needs. Thanaa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. Thanaa has been a microcredit client for twelve years now and has always paid on time. 
Thanaa is a very devoted woman, who works hard to supplement her family’s income and give the best for her children. Her previous loans helped her improve her work, by purchasing new clothes and answering her clients’ needs. Thanaa is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to satisfy her clients. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Thanaa decided on doing her business because she wanted to have independent work. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 50 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Jamal has been doing handicrafts for twenty years. Jamal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase accessories for his work and pay his children’s school tuition. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Jamal is special in his work because of his creativity and he knows how to understand his clients demands. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have independent work, but most importantly, because he likes what he does. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for his work and pay his children’s school tuition.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn P. was born in 1946 and lives in Proeus Leu village in Takeo province. She is a rice middle woman. She is a widow with a child who is a farmer. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, her child sells palm sugar in the local village. Since her child's business is going well, she wants her child to sell the sugar door to door so Mrs. Hoeurn P. is requesting a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her child to sell sugar.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to sell sugar.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum K., 36 and her husband, Mr. Chan Long, 38, live in a small village along nation road number five, which is about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1986 and have 7 children: 4 sons and 3 daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, while two work in a garment factory and another three are in school. 

Sarum has been selling pickled fruits in the market since 1994, while her husband is a construction worker. Her house breaks down in some parts, which makes it difficult for her family to stay, so she is requesting a loan of US$500 in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair her house where she lives.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 36 year old businesswoman and the mother of three girls. She sells ladies shoes and slippers in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for ten years and hopes to expand it into a wholesale business, that will generate a profit. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more ladies shoes, slippers, and rubber shoes. She describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a successful distributor.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a clothing store for over thirty years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise and answering more his clients’ needs. Ali is special in his work because his has competitive prices and is generous with his clients because they can bargain prices. His clients are mainly his friends, neighbors and passer-bys. When he first started his business, he had to face difficulties since he took after his father’s work and he was already known and had a good reputation in his region. In the future, he plans on improving his store by diversifying more his merchandise and start selling children’s clothes as well.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 49 years old and married with two children. He is the provider for eight dependents including several extended family members. His son and his daughter, aged 19 and 22 years respectively, live in Bo (the second largest town in Sierra Leone) with Jeffrey and his wife. His daughter is a college graduate. His son attends high school and is planning to attend university upon graduation.

To help supplement his income and support his family, Jeffery, an experienced accountant, left his job on a study leave for 2 years to open a pharmacy. Although Jeffery has recently obtained another accounting job at a local firm, he continues to manage the pharmacy where he employs one person. The neatly kept pharmacy is located in a residential area of Bo.

With this loan, Jeffery plans to restock drugs needed by the local community and to provide for his family.

loans.use: To restock drugs needed by the local community

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married to Nfona Joseph and they have five children. Sylvia and her entire family live in a house with two bed rooms, one sitting room and a kitchen. Being a very hard working woman, she has overcome challenges in her life such as her husband's bad attitude, excessive drinking, smoking and returning home very late at night.

Sylvia runs a koki and palm wine selling business with the support of her children and her now reformed husband. She will invest the loan to buy koki beans to produce koki pudding which they eat with plantains, potatoes or yams. She also plans to invest the loan in palm wine (white stuff). With her previous loans she provided her community with white stuff (white liquid from raffia palms) for their social activities. With this loan, she also plans to buy beans and beer.

This will be her third loan from Kiva partner GHAPE since she joined in 2007. She has been successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), quality of food and reasonable prices. She buys in bulk which minimizes costs. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales.

Part of the profits generated will be used for the school fees of her children and another part will be used to buy a plot. Sylvia does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She plans to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To puchase bulk food products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and expanding her arable land

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 43 year old mother of five who sells new clothes. She has been in this business for two years and hopes to be a role model in business in her area. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add stock of clothes to her business. She hopes to educate her children and have a prosperous family. She describes herself as positive.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes to her shop.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 30 year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. For eight years, Khaled has been working as a tomato farmer.
