Él cuenta con 10 hectáreas cultivadas de arroz y como ya está en temporada de siembra, necesita contratar personal para el cultivo de su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse ocupado y velar por el mantenimiento de su chacra. Él considera que su actividad es rentable porque su producto lo vende directamente en el mercado de su zona y sus compradores son generalmente mayoristas quienes están a la espera de su producción. Para más adelante, Noe desea incursionar en la siembra de café.  
Este es su  primer préstamo con MFP, es nuevo en un banco comunal,  pero ya tienen una buena impresión de sus compañeros de grupo, pues ha notado que son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más granos de arroz para seguir sembrando en su chacra, también contratara al personal necesario para trabajar en sus chacras.

loans.use: Compra de semilla

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 44 años, vive a lado a su esposa y sus 5 hijos que están estudiando, el mayor en la universidad y los demás en el nivel secundario y primario del colegio. Él se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en la parte de afuera de su casa, los platillos que prepara son salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas), salchipolllos (pedazos de pollo, salchicha y papas fritas), anticuchos (brochetas) y choncholines (vísceras de res fritas), todos ellos, platos típicos de su región. Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la encargada de atender a los clientes. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 3 años, sin embargo no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, pues también es profesor desde hace 18 años. Lo que le gusta a Roger de sus actividades es que lo mantienen activo, no trabaja cansado y le son muy rentables, ya que el ingreso diario que tiene con la venta de comida es para sus gastos familiares y con su sueldo mensual de docente cubre la educación de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes trabajan bien y se dan confianza unos a otros para seguir adelante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mesas y sillas para su negocio, porque las que tiene actualmente no abastecen a sus clientes que diariamente acuden a su pequeño puesto. Y con otra parte del dinero seguirá ahorrando para comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Roger is 44 years old, he lives with his wife and their 5 children who are in school. The oldest child is in college and the others are in secondary and primary school. Roger sells food outside his home at night. He prepares salchipapas (french fries and sausages), salchipollos (chicken, sausage, and french fries), anticuchos (kebabs), and choncholines (fried cow intestine), all typical dishes of the region. He depends on the help of his wife, who attends to their customers. He has done this work for 3 years, however, it is not his only work activity. Roger has been a professor for 18 years. What Roger likes best about his work is that it keeps him busy but doesn't tire him and it is very profitable. The daily income he earns selling food covers household expenses and his monthly salary as a professor pays for education for his children. This is his second loan with MFP and what Roger likes about his community bank is that between all the members they work well together and give each other the confidence to keep advancing. With the money he is requesting, he will buy tables and chairs for his business. He currently doesn't have anywhere to seat the customers that come to his small food stand every day. With another portion of the money he will continue saving in order to buy land.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 52 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y con su esposo en su casa propia. Su rutina diaria es levantarse a las 5 de la mañana para dirigirse a un puerto fluvial cercano a su casa para esperar la llegada de los agricultores, quienes traen diversos productos para vender.  Rosa compra 80 racimos de plátanos diariamente, los cuales vende en uno de los mercados de su localidad, normalmente termina de vender esta fruta en un par de horas, porque sus clientes ya la conocen y la esperan, obteniendo así muy buenas ganancias. En esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y llevan trabajando juntos 2 años. Lo que le gusta a Rosa de su trabajo es aprender más sobre el comercio y considera que lo más importante es dar una buena atención a sus clientes. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ya conoce a los miembros de su grupo y cree que trabajarán bien juntos, pues todas son personas muy responsables. Con 200 soles del dinero que solicita comprará un puesto en el mercado y con el resto comprará más plátanos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old; she lives with her 3 children and her husband in the house they own. Everyday she gets up at 5:00 a.m. and goes to a river port near her house to wait for farmers who bring various products to sell. Rosa buys 80 bunches of bananas everyday, which she sells in one of the markets in town. She normally finishes selling the fruit in just a few hours, because her customers know and wait for her. She earns good income from the sales. Rosa's husband helps her and the two have worked together for 2 years. What Rosa likes most about her work is learning more about business. She believes it is most important to provide good customer service. This is her first loan with MFP; she already knows the members of her group and believes they will work well together, as all the members are very responsible. With 200 PEN of the money she is requesting she will buy a stall in the market, and with the remaining money she will buy more bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a market stall and more merchandise

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 44 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de cacao (planta que sirve para la elaboración de chocolate), cuenta con 2 hectáreas cultivadas de este producto y también de plátanos y otras frutas. Sembrando cacao lleva un periodo de 2 años; pero como su terreno es muy amplio, hace un año lo alquiló para la crianza de ganado, animales que él mismo cuida y obtiene ingresos extras por esta actividad. Lo que le gusta a Santos de su labor es que se mantiene ocupado y lo ayuda a olvidarse de algunas circunstancias difíciles, además la venta de cacao le permite tener lo necesario para vivir tranquilo. Para más adelante está planeado sembrar yuca y maíz. 
Con MFP ya tiene 2 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los miembros se apoyan entre sí, no hay problemas y pagan sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para sus plantaciones de cacao y contratará a 2 personas para que le ayuden a cosechar su producto.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old. He is single and lives alone in his own house. His business is growing cacao (the plant used to make chocolate). He has 2 hectares planted in this product as well as bananas and other fruits.

Growing cacao takes 2 years, but because his land is large, a year ago he rented it for raising cattle. He takes care of the animals himself and is paid for this. Santos enjoys his work; it keeps him busy and helps him forget some of his difficult circumstances. The cacao business gives him what he needs to live happily. In the future, he plans to plant yucca and corn also.

Santos already has taken out 2 loans with MFP. What he likes about his communal bank is that the members help each other, there are no problems, and they make their payments on time. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer for his cacao plantation and hire 2 people to help with the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teodolo

texts.es:
Teodolo tiene 51 años, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas que son madres solteras. Desde hace 4 años atrás se dedica a la siembra y cultivo del arroz, actualmente cuenta con 10 hectáreas por cosechar y tiene el apoyo de sus hijas y esposa para esta labor. Desde muy joven Teodolo se caracterizó por ser muy trabajador, es por ello que no sólo se dedica al cultivo del arroz, ya que también cría pollos en un pequeño galpón que construyó en su casa. Teodolo menciona que tiene la sangre de agricultor y mientras tenga familia trabajará duro para sostener sus necesidades. Considera rentable el cultivo del arroz porque es un producto que tiene mucha demanda y sobre todo porque ya tiene clientes fijos.
Con MFP ya tiene 4 préstamos y lo que gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que entre todos se comprenden y trabajan en unión. Con MFP ya tiene 4 préstamos y lo que gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que entre todos se comprenden y trabajan en unión.

loans.use: Compra de semilla y pollos para criar

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 56 años, es padre soltero y vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Él se dedica a la siembra de plátanos en su propia chacra, donde también vive. Víctor empezó sembrando 80 “machquis” (plantones) de plátanos, pero como ha notado que éste es un negocio muy rentable en su región, ahora cuenta con 4 hectáreas de plátanos y es quien abastece de este producto a algunos vendedores del mercado de su localidad. A Víctor le gusta mucho su trabajo porque desde muy joven se inclinó por la agricultura, pero su mayor motivación es su hijo, quien va a necesitar de toda su ayuda para salir adelante. 
Con MFP ya tienen 7 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son buenas personas y muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita contratará personal para trabajar en el mantenimiento de su chacra.

loans.use: Contratación de personal para su chacras

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 37 años y vive con su esposa, quien lo apoya mucho. Él es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de su zona. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás, pero también cuenta con una chacra donde tiene cultivadas 3 hectáreas de naranjas y mandarinas, por lo que cada fin de semana acude a cosechar sus productos para traerlos a vender al mercado de su localidad. Lo que le gusta a Víctor de sus trabajos es mantenerse activo y considera que le son rentables; porque en el caso de su labor como transportista, sus ganancias son diarias y en el caso de la fruta, casi siempre logra obtener un buen precio por sus productos. Para más adelante, Víctor quiere implementar un taller de mecánica, pues quiere demostrar las habilidades en el oficio que estudió. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a trabajar responsablemente con el apoyo de su banco comunal y a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un aproximado de 200 soles en repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, pues está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas. Con lo restante adquirirá materiales de construcción para hacer algunas mejoras a su casa.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor  tiene 62 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Todos viven en su casa propia. Él es propietario de una chacra donde viene radicando desde hace 40 años y donde también siembra variedades de productos, pero el principal es el arroz. Para todas las tareas que conlleva esta actividad agrícola, Víctor cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposa y ya llevan 20 años produciendo arroz. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que lo hace sentirse útil ante su familia y su comunidad, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con clientes fijos quienes están a la expectativa de su cosecha.
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes se comprenden y son puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá íntegramente en el incremento de su producción agrícola.

loans.use: Incremento de su producción

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 48 años, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudiantes y uno, mayor de edad. Vive junto  a su esposo en la casa de sus suegros. Ella cuenta en una chacra de 5 hectáreas de palma aceitera, pero también siembra yuca y frutos cítricos, y cría gallinas. Para estas labores cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se siente feliz de tener a su a lado a una mujer muy trabajadora. En esta actividad ya tiene un periodo de 2 años, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a la crianza de cerdos, con lo que no le fue bien por los constantes robos que sufría. Lo que le gusta a Zoila de su trabajo es estar en constante actividad, pero lo que más le satisface es la cosecha de sus productos y observar cómo sus plantas van creciendo cada día. Zoila considera que su negocio le es rentable porque todos sus productos los lleva ella misma a vender al mercado de su zona, obteniendo un buen precio y por ende buenas ganancias.
Este es su 4to crédito con MFP y lo que más le gusta trabajar de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son muy comprensivos y trabajadores. Le dinero que solicita lo invertirá en su íntegramente en su chacra, comprando abono y alimentos para sus animales.

loans.use: Compra de abono y alimento para sus animales

loans.name: Adela's Group

texts.en:
Adela A. is a young hardworking wife who strives to be able to help her husband improve their family's living conditions, to save for their children’s futures and to fix their home. She and her husband, Arman have four young children who range from two to four years in age and the family lives in the village of Tabao Rizal. San Enrique, Negros Occidental. 

Adela is 39 years old and has established herself as a skillful entrepreneur for almost 10 years since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999. When she got her first loan, she invested it in food vending of Native Ilonggo delicacies such as "bayi-bayi" and "kalamayhati" which are made of rice flour, whole brown sugar and coconut milk.Over the years, her food products have become quite popular in the community to the point where the increased demand has required her husband to help with production and delivery. Larger loans made it possible for Adela to establish a networking business as well. Her income has grown to an average of PHP 10,000 per month, which has enabled her to fix her dilapidated house and set aside some savings for her children's future .Adela's products taste so good that it was selected by NWTF's Client Services Department to be one of the sugar-based products it featured in a week-long trade fair that it organized in August at SM City Bacolod, the biggest mall in Negros Occidental.  Her products were so well received by the mall shoppers that it she will be offering them again in the trade-fair rerun at SM City Bacolod this October during the Masskara Festival, which is a famous tourist event in the island.  It is expected to be one of the best and fast selling products in the trade fair.She borrowed PHP 19,500 for her previous loan and used it as additional working capital for her food vending and networking business. That loan was fully paid on time. For her next 14th cycle loan she wants to borrow the same amount of PHP 19,500 which she intends to use again as additional capital for her native foods vending and networking business.Adela is shown in the picture posing with some of the networking products that she sells.About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to have additional working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 39 años, es separada, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Ella tiene una amplia experiencia en el negocio de la ferretería, pero hace 2 años decidió formalizarse arrendando un local donde no sólo vende artículos ferreteros, sino también ofrece el servicio de cerrajería. Todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, Ana atiende su establecimiento y con su cálido trato logra el retorno de sus clientes, es por eso que en tan poco tiempo su ferretería ha prosperado. Esto la anima aún más porque se siente independiente económicamente y puede solventar las necesidades de sus hijas, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo. El sueño a futuro de Ana es ampliar su local para incrementar su mercadería. Adicionalmente tienen unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y a trabajar en conjunto para lograr un clima de solidaridad en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de hierro, que es uno de los artículos que se vende en su ferretería y tiene mayor demanda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza tiene 60 años, es viuda y vive con una D. sus hijas y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ella siembra principalmente papa y maíz, estos productos los lleva a la ciudad más cercana a su zona para comercializarlos. D. esta manera obtiene los recursos que necesita para su hogar; paralelamente cría pollos en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Los vecinos D. Eliza saben que ella cría a sus aves con dedicación y buen alimento, por lo que todos los fines D. semana le hacen pedidos D. sus pollos. Eliza desea seguir trabajando en las tareas agrícolas y en la crianza D. sus animales hasta donD. le alcancen las fuerzas, menciona.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es conocida por ser una persona muy responsable y es por esa razón que los miembros D. su actual banco comunal la invitaron a formar parte del grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será para comprar sacos D. abono para su próxima temporada D. siembra.
texts.en:
Eliza is 60 years old, a widow, and lives with her daughters and 2 grandchildren in her own house. She has worked in agriculture almost her entire life. She grows mostly potatoes and corn. She takes these products to the city closest to her zone to market them. This is how she obtains the resources that she needs for her home. At the same time, she raises chickens in a space set up in her house. Eliza’s neighbors know that she raises her birds with dedication and feeds them well, so that by the end of the week they all have ordered chickens from her. Eliza says that she wants to continue working in farming and the raising of animals until she is successful at them.

This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She is known to be a very responsible person and this is the reason that the members of her current community bank invited her to join the group. The money that she is asking for will be to buy sacks of fertilizer for the next growing season.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchas of fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor D. sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, actualmente cultiva principalmente la papa y el maíz. Y cuando es época D. cosecha tiene un arduo trabajo, desD. el recojo D. los frutos hasta la comercialización D. sus productos en el mercado principal D. su ciudad. Esta actividad le ha servido para sostener las necesidades D. su casa durante años, en compañía D. su esposo y ahora sus hijos son hombres D. bien. Por ello, el deseo D. Esther es seguir mejorando la producción D. sus tierras y solventar la educación del último D. sus hijos.
Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una D. las fundadoras D. su banco comunal y durante todo este tiempo (4 años aproximadamente) ha notado los frutos D. trabajar en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su próxima siembra D. papa.
texts.en:
Esther is 54 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest child in her own house. Since childhood, she has been involved in agricultural work. Currently, her principal crops are potatoes and corn. During harvest season, she engages in arduous work, from gathering her crops to the sale of her produce in the main market of her city.

For years, with help from her husband, and now her sons, who are honorable men, this business has allowed her to meet her household’s needs. Esther’s wish is to continue improving the production from her fields and to pay for her sons’ final education.

This is the ninth time she has had a loan with MFP. She is one of the founders of her communal bank, and during all this time (approximately 4 years) she has noticed the importance of working as a team. The money that she is now applying for will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next planting of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 45 años, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos de 21, 17 y 15 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas con ayuda de sus hijos, que en ese entonces eran niños y con el tiempo fueron incrementando sus esfuerzos. Hoy tienen varias cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino, y cuentan con algunos terrenos donde cultivan hortalizas y papa. Por ello, todos los días Flor vende la leche de sus vacas y supervisar el buen crecimiento de sus plantaciones. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con sus cultivos y mejorar la raza de sus vacas.  
Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, para ella trabajar con el apoyo de un banco comunal es una experiencia nueva. El dinero que está solicitando será para la compra de sacos de abono que le servirán para sembrar alfalfa (alimento de sus animales) y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Flor is 45 years old. She is a widow and lives in her own house with her 3 children, aged 21, 17 and 15. For the past 17 years, she has worked in agriculture with the help of her children, who began when they were young and have been able to contribute more and more over time. Today, the family has several cows and sheep, as well as a few plots of land where they cultivate potatoes and other vegetables. Every day, Flor sells the milk from her cows and checks on the progress of her crops. Her desire is to continue expanding her cultivated fields and improve the quality of her cows. This is Flor's first opportunity to take on a loan with MFP; for her, working with the support of a communal bank is a new experience. The funds she is requesting will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer, which will allow her to plant alfalfa (to feed her animals) and more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe A. who lives in the village of Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental, is 33 years old and married to Reynaldo A., Jr. who presently works as a furniture designer. The couple is blessed with five young children ranging in age from 4 to 16 years old. Ma. Fe dreams that when her five children are all grown up, she will have provided them with a good education that will prepare them to have a good livelihood that would enable them to live a good life. Because her children are growing up, the household's expenses are also increasing because she needs to send them to school on top of the other basic necessities. This is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: to get financial support in running her business. She started by selling Ready-to-Wear products which she sold just around her community. She even brought her products when she attended the Center meeting to sell to her center-mates. Her business activities earns her an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Because of her good performance at NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Fe is allowed to obtain a bigger loan. For her 14th loan she borrowed Php 29,500 as additional working capital for her business. The amount was repaid in weekly installments and was fully paid on time without any delays. For her 15th loan Ma. Fe is borrowing Php 19,500 to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Whatever income she earns will be used for the improvement and expansion of the business. She is borrowing a smaller amount this time because she is anticipating a slower business turnover because it is now the rainy season, an off-season for the sugar plantations which directly affects her sales. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.es:
Jackqueline tienen 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de granos como el maíz, la cebada, la arveja, las habas y la quinua, productos que ella misma cultiva en sus tierras. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace más de 3 años, por lo que todos los miércoles y los fines de semana comercializa sus granos al por mayor y menor. Por tal motivo, siempre está pendiente de los precios del mercado porque de eso dependen sus ganancias. De esta manera, Jackqueline ve los frutos de su trabajo y junto a su esposo, generan el desarrollo de su familia. Su deseo a futuro es poder producir los granos en gran escala y convertirse en una exitosa comerciante.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que realizará con su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar los granos que regularmente cultiva.
texts.en:
Jackqueline is 36 and lives with her husband and two children, who are 6 and 2. She sells grains such as corn, barley, peas, beans, and quinoa. She grows these products herself on her land. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Every Wednesday and on the weekends, she sells her grains both wholesale and retail. Because of this, she is always dependent on the market prices because her profits depend on them. In this way, Jackqueline sees the fruits of her labor, and, along with her husband, they generate the development of their family. Her hope for the future is to be able to produce grains on a large scale and to become a successful merchant. This is her first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very enthusiastic about the work she will do with her communal bank. She will invest the money that she is requesting in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to use on the grains that she usually grows.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 18 años, vive en casa de sus padres, disfrutando de la compañía de los mismos. Su madre le enseñó la importancia del trabajo y es por esta razón que se dedica a cuidar de su propia granja de cuyes. Su rutina diaria de trabajo consiste en cortar la alfalfa de sus pastizales  para alimentar a sus cuyes, posteriormente se va a estudiar. Cada mes o de acuerdo a los pedidos comercializa sus animalitos, preferentemente los machos, por eso trata de mantenerlos con un buen peso y tamaño. Jorge desea para el futuro tener una granja mucho más grande donde pueda albergar a más cuyes e incrementar sus ventas.
Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable, pagando con  puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de madera y rejillas de metal para ampliar y mejorar su criadero de cuyes.

loans.use: Ampliación de su criadero de cuyes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo. Desde niña ha aprendido el valor del trabajo en la agricultura y actualmente también tiene ganado vacuno. Cada día, Lidia supervisa sus plantas para que estén libres de insectos y plagas, velando por el buen desarrollo de sus productos. Los fines de semana, se dedica a la venta de sus animales y los productos que tenga almacenados de su anterior cosecha. Lidia está muy contenta con la labor que  realiza y más aun cuando su hijo está libre de sus tareas escolares y la ayuda con sus labores agrícolas. 
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, cuando le informaron la metodología de trabajo de un banco comunal, aceptó gustosa, por lo que compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales como cerdos y ovejas para luego de criarlos venderlos a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Lidia is 60 years old and lives in her own house along with her son. Since she was a girl, she has learned the value of working in agriculture, and she currently operates a farm that includes cattle. Each day, Lidia tends her crops, making sure that they are free of disease and insects and ensuring that they are growing well. She dedicates her weekends to selling her animals and the products she has stored from her most recent harvest. Lidia is very happy with her work, and even more so when her son has finished his schoolwork and has time to help her on the farm. This is her first loan with MFP; when she learned about the working methodology of a communal bank, she accepted enthusiastically, making a commitment to be punctual in her payments. The funds she is requesting will be invested in purchasing more animals, such as pigs and sheep, so that she can raise them and sell them for a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia tiene 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas apoyando a sus padres, pero hace 40 años decidió que ésta sería también la mejor manera de generarse sus propios ingresos económicos. Por ello, en la actualidad siembra en las tierras que heredó de sus padres los productos típicos de su zona como la papa, el maíz, el trigo, la arveja, etc. Prudencia comercializa estos productos directamente en el mercado de su localidad y es su hija quien la ayuda a administrar sus ganancias. Adicionalmente cría animales (cuyes y cerdos), los cuales compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su zona y con cuyas ganancias sustenta sus necesidades diarias mientras espera la cosecha. Su deseo a futuro es aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. 
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que  tiene grandes expectativas de su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en todas sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sus cultivos y medicinas para sus animales.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 56 years old and lives with her daughter in her own house. Since she was very young she has dedicated herself to agricultural tasks, helping her parents until 40 years ago, when she decided this would also be the best way to generate her own income. For that goal, at present, she sows the lands she inherited from her parents, growing produce typical of the region, such as potatoes, corn, wheat, honey mesquit, etc.

Prudencia sells these products directly in the local market and her daughter helps her with the administration of the earnings. In addition, she raises animals (guinea pigs and pigs), which she buys and sells on weekends in the local livestock fair. In this way they maintain themselves while awaiting the harvest. Her desire for the future is to increase the quantity of animals she has.

This is the first time she has requested a credit with MFP. She has great expectations for her community bank and accepts the responsibility to be prompt with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of manure for her crops and medicines for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FERTILIZER AND MEDICINES FOR LIVESTOCK

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, animales que atiende todos los días en su establo, con alimento especializado y la alfalfa que ella misma cultiva. También siembra otros productos como papa, maíz, arveja, cebolla, entre otros. Yolanda obtiene la leche de sus vacas diariamente, la cual vende a sus vecinos y amistades. Los años de intenso trabajo le han permitido mantener la economía de su hogar estable, aun en momentos difíciles, razón por la cual está planeando su futuro adquiriendo más animales y extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción agrícola.
Esta es la primera vez que Yolanda tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada por trabajar con su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is a 47-year-old single woman who lives in the village of Crossing Pacol, Palaka, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She stayed unmarried up to now because she has been busy earning a living and supporting her parents. She doesn't really regret not getting married when she was much younger because she still has a family life. At present, she's helping one nephew in his college expenses. She hopes that when he graduates he will also be able to help elevate their family out of poverty permanently.

Even though she does not have any dependents except for her parents, Evelyn still strives hard to improve her family's quality of life. In 2003, when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access new capital for her business, she invested it in a general store adjacent to her house. She used her subsequent loans to start selling ready-to-wear clothes in her community. Later she even began selling frozen products to a few regular clients. Sometimes she also sells vegetables and other seasonal products to earn extra income. Her current average monthly net income is PHP 2,500.

She hopes that in the near future she will be able to afford to buy a tricycle - a motorcycle with a sidecar so that she will be able to transport her products a lot faster.

She used her previous loan of PHP 19,500 as working capital and paid back the weekly installments diligently, and now that she's paid it in full, she is again applying to borrow PHP 22,500 to be used as additional working capital for her general store, RTW products, frozen food and vegetable vending. 
She hopes to use the income to support her nephew's education, save up for her tricycle and continue supporting her parents.

Evelyn is very grateful for the help that NWTF-Project Dungganon has extended to her so that she could achieve her dreams. Evelyn is now the Deputy Center Chief in her NWTF-PD center because her group mates and the NWTF team see her potential and skill in motivating and encouraging other members to follow polices and procedures of NWTF-Project Dungganon so that their center will have overall good performance.
	
About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her general store and other business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline H. is a little depress in what happen to the education of her children. At her age of 56 she has now 4 children namely: Rowena 30 years old, Fernando Jr. 25 years old, Angelo and Wennalyn the youngest, most of them are only attain a secondary level of education. Her husband Fernando H. is now 65 years old and helping her to improve their business, their helping each other and also their children to overcome their poverty.

Their main source of income today is their fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman that is why she manages their business with the help of Evangeline. This business run for 4 years now and until now it gives them income for their daily expenses. When Evangeline joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan that she received for this business like today she will also use the loan to buy necessary things needed in her business like small boat for their fishing business and same things needed in expanding the fish cage like fishnet, accessories for the fishnet and bamboo. She was sure buying for this will make her business improve the income than before.

One really hope of Evangeline is her grandchildren finish their studies until they become a degree holder, she doesn’t want to happen what happen to her children that only attain a low level of education. She assures to herself that he will do everything for them not to experience the hard things in life.

loans.use: For additional capital to her fishing business

loans.name: Lumuli A Jane Namuyiga Group

texts.en: Jane N. is forty-two years of age, a widow with three children schooling and she is also looking after one sibling schooling too. She is operating two business activities that is out-side catering and brick making for constructions. She has stayed in these businesses so far for seven years. She is using the loan to purchase necessary items to support her businesses that is serving utensils like plates, cups, flasks, sauce pans, etc for out side catering and more so paying the people helping her in brick making. She is a hardworking business woman whose hope is to prosper and become rich in life.

loans.use: To purchase necessary items to support her businesses that is serving utensils like plates, cups, flasks, sauce pans, etc for out side catering and more so paying the people helping her in brick making.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., 55, is of the same age as her husband, Alfredo C.. They have 3 children: Mary Jane and Mary Grace are twins (both are 33 years old), and the youngest is Mariette (28 years old). Her husband used to work as a fisherman earlier until they decided to run a fishing business. They started the business with small fish cage with few fingerlings. Later, the number of fingerlings increased. Their business recently completed 8 years mainly because of their perseverance for improving their business.

One thing that Remedios wanted is capital to expand her business. So she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) and used the loan for the improvement of her business. She plans to use her loan to buy fishnet, bamboo and accessories for the fishnet and also to pay the laborer.

Remedios dreams of having a successful business someday, so that her family will be secured for a better future. She is striving hard today with the help of her husband and her three children to make this dream possible.

loans.use: Additional capital in her fishing business

loans.name: Lumuli A Miriam Wagaba Group

texts.en: Miriam W. is 50 years old and is the cashier of her group. She is a single mother of six children, of which three go to school. Besides, she has three other dependents who are also schooling. She operates a retail business selling necessities such as salt, paraffin, sugar, soap and others. She has been running her business for four years. She is requesting a loan to improve her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as salt, paraffin, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C., 32, is one year older than her husband, Adrian C.. They have three children: Andrea Eliz, 10; Ariane, 8; and Aubrey, 1. These three little angels have been their inspiration to rise above poverty. As parents, they want to give their children a better future through education. That’s why she is helping her husband in earning income for their daily expenses. They have a fishing business. Her husband is the one who focuses on the business, while she helps him in his activities.

According to Elizabeth, her loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has helped them a lot in improving their business. Since she became a member, her income from her business has increased, and now they have more capital to buy daily necessities. She will use her 5th loan again to buy things needed in expanding their fish cage.

Elizabeth together with her husband hopes that their children will finish their studies; they believe in the saying "Education is the key to success." They hope that someday their children will take the initiative to make their house bigger and better.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena B., 31, is married to Edison B.. They are blessed with two children: Mark Edison, 9, is in grade 4 in primary level, and Mark Joseph, 5, is in the nursery level. According to Ma. Magdalena, the expenses for the schooling of their two children is not much right now. However, she wants to save early for their future needs in school. Hence she is pursuing her sewing business, which is their main source of income. She has been running this business for two years with help from her husband, who is also a sewer. With both of them working, they hope to increase their income.

When she joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she used the loan as additional capital for her business; now she will do the same. She plans to use the loan to buy one sewing machine, which is a five threads machine. She really needs this machine for her sewing business. She thinks this machine coupled with their perseverance will make their business more productive.

Ma. Magdalena’s dream is to continue to run her business and have more sewing machines, so that she can help their neighborhood who has no source of income for employing them as sewers. And if her business will grow, her family will be benefitted the most, as she can save for the future of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Margret is 47 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en: Frederick is married with four children and lives at Ngyen-Mbo, Cameroon. Frederic and his entire family live in a house with two rooms. Frederic had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill-health, untimely death of family members, and inadequate funds to take good care of his family. He operates a palm oil production business with the loans given to him and people also pay him to process palm oil for them. Frederick has been a member of GHAPE since 2001 and this will be his eighth loan. He has been quite successful in the past with his business due to his location, and he is trusted by his customers. Also, with the experience he now has, many people are coming to have their palm oil processed. Part of Frederick’s profits from his loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for the family, and give them good medication whenever they are sick. He will use part of the profits to save as a precaution. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a palm oil mill

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden T. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour. Kiden is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is married with four children. Three of them are under 15 years of age. Martha lives in Kobenyang in Cameroon and her entire family lives in a house with four rooms. This is Martha’s fifth loan from GHAPE and her previous repayments were made promptly. She has encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her sister, being a school dropout, and ill health. These problems made life difficult for her until, in 2004, she saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member. With her loan, Martha plans to buy cocoa, coffee and stalk and will sell whenever they are scarce so that she can make more profit. Martha is convinced the business will succeed because she has a ready market for her product. With the profit from her loan, Martha plans to pay school fees for her children and clothe them, feed them, and give them sound medical attention whenever they are sick. Martha plans to obtain her loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient. And also because GHAPE is trustworthy and proper follow up is done to ensure the loan is properly managed. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy coffee, cocoa and stalk to sell

loans.name: Nantabulirwa A Namusago Sylvia Group

texts.en:
N. Sylvia is thirty-six years old and is a single mother blessed with three children who are schooling. She also has two dependents (her parents).

Sylvia has been operating a pub, selling drinks such as beer, soda, wine, etc., for five years. She is using the loan to purchase more drinks to meet her customers’ different tastes. She wishes to stock more and boost her business.

Sylvia is a very active woman. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: Tebug

texts.en:
V. is a widow and she is having five children with three of them below the age of fifteen years. She lives in Acha-tudit in Cameroon. V. and her entire family lives in a house with three rooms. This is V.’s fourth year as a GHAPE member; she has been in GHAPE since the year 2005. With the loan given to her, she plans to buy cocoyams, palm oil, ground nuts, and Koki beans for retailing. She is convinced the business will succeed because of the good business site she is having, she is also having a ready market for her goods to be sold. V. has encountered some major challenges in life shush as the death of her husband, ill health and un adequate funds to pay for her children school fees. Because of all these, V. saw GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2005 and became a member. With the profit from her loan, she plans to pay her children school fees, Cloth them, give good feeding to her family and sound medication when ever they are sick. This her project will help the community to supply them with food stuff, provide them with late night services for those who wants to buy some food items in the night. V. prefer to receive loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE is trust worthy and reliable and loans are given without any collateral security. 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and Selling of Cocoyams, Groundniuts, Palm oil and Koki Beans

loans.name: Ambanga

texts.en:
Ambanga J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens . 

 Ambanga is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her resturant.

texts.en: Abau S. is currently in the business of selling phaste and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make phaste to sell. Abau is 22 years old and is married. Her husband who is a soldier. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. Asha is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. texts.en: Harun R. is currently in the business of selling fruit like apples, bananas, etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase fish and cooking oil to sell. Harun is 32 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. loans.name: Siama

texts.en: Siama R. is currently in the business of selling bread and ice cream and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Siama is 39 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a bar for selling wine and beer. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Rahma

texts.en: Rahma J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more rice, beans, etc. to sell. Rahma is 30 years old and is married to a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Rahma hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To stock more beans and rice in her restaurant

loans.name: Achan

texts.en: Achan R. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs for her restaurant for better accommodation. Achan is 35 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Achan hopes to be able to extend the floor space of her restaurant by buying some iron sheets. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To buy more tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Sumbua

texts.en:
Sumbua B. runs a restaurant that serves tea and bread. Her restaurant walls are thatched with papyrus. Sumbua is requesting a loan in order to buy siding made of iron sheets to cover the walls of her restaurant.

Sumbua is 29 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children. Both her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Sumbua hopes to be able to build a backer for the restaurant walls.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheet siding for the papyrus walls of her restaurant.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 27 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer in Majengo, Nairobi. He is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to open a kerosene business. Patrick hopes to own two Public Service Vehicles in ten years and to earn enough to buy his family a home. He describes himself as hardworking and development-conscious. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA SEPARADA DE SU MARIDO SE DEDICO A TRABAJAR SOLA Y MANTUVO A SUS DOS HIJOS HASTA QUE ESTOS SE INDEPENDIZARON, AHORA ELLA TRABAJA PARA SU PROPIO BIEN. ES RESPONSABLE CON SUS PAGOS Y TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS SIN IMPORTAR LAS INCLEMENCIAS DEL TIEMPO ACTUALMENTE SE ESTA HACIENDO CARGO DE UNA SOBRINA LA CUAL SUFRIA MALTRATOS DE SU MADRASTRA. EL CREDITO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE PELICULAS DE ESTRENO EN EL FORMATO DVD.

loans.use: Invertira en compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Victor M. trabaja como transportista desde sus quince años, el trabajaba como asalariado durante muchos años, y a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo logro comprar su vehiculo propio a un anterior jefe que el tenia,desde entonces el trabaja como propietario, es conocido en el sindicato donde el trabaja, es una persona muy activa y trabajadora, la esposa tiene tambien tiene un negocio propio de venta de café, y además realiza trabajos de costura, ellos tratan de dar todo a sus hijos, las comodidades que ellos no tuvieron.

loans.use: INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MEDIO PAQUETE DE MOTOR

loans.name: Señor De Mayo Chimba Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy antiguo y muy responsables en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SEÑOR D. MAYO CHIMBA ", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora  Deysi G. ,ella es lider D. su grupo, venD. comida, vive en casa familiar tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como  taxista libre, su niño menor tiene la enfermedad D. sindrome D. Down. Como tesorera esta la socia Erika Sulma M.  quien es  socia nueva, pero el grupon la conoce como una persona responsable y  sociable. Esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, Tiene su internet en su domicilio como tambien venD. cosmeticos , el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital para su internet . Como secretaria esta la socia Jhoana C. L.  quien es una socia joven, , venD. cosmeticos por catalogos y entrega ropa a credito por su barrio, como tambien trabaja en una imprenta.
texts.en:
This is a very old group that is very responsible with its payments. The members live in the same neighborhood where they know each other well. The group is called "Señor D. Mayo Chimba," where the communal bank is in its 2nd cycle. The Board of Directors is maD. up of members who are very responsible with their money collection and are very united.

As president, Deysi G. is the leader of the group. She sells food and lives in a house with her three children. Her husband works as a taxidriver, and her youngest son has Downs Syndrome.

As treasurer, Erika is a new member, but the group knows her as a responsible and friendly individual. She is married and has four children. She has internet at home and also sells cosmetics. She will use the loan to increase capital for her internet.

As secretary, Jhoana is a young member. She sells cosmetics through catalogues and sells clothing on credit in her neighborhood. She also works in a printing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La Señora Isabel Hernández tiene 55 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos no son independiente lo tiene estudiando. Los proyectos que tiene son darle a sus hijos un mejor provenir por medio su trabajo. Doña Isabel tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo como cocinera en una casa y tiene su negocio de ventas de ropas desde hace un año, las dificultades el bajo ingreso para la compra de productos. Gracias  A Afodenic por el préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la comprar de productos como: ropa para damas, perfumes, zapatos, ropas interior y cosméticos teniendo una variedad de productos y obteniendo mayor utilidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel Hernández is a 55-year-old single mother with three minor children who are all in school. She works to give her children a better future. Mrs. Isabel works part time as a home cook and also has had a clothing business for the past year. Her low income makes it difficult to buy merchandise. She is grateful to Afodenic (Kiva field partner) for the loan which she will use to buy products such as women's clothing, perfumes, shoes, underwear, and cosmetics. Having a variety of products will allow her to earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and shoes

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: La joven Wendy Solís de 23 años de edad, ha logrado a muchas dificultad salir  adelante con sus estudios, con ayuda de sus padres y ahora de  su esposo que la ha apoyado. Se recibió de Licenciada en Enfermería, tiene veinte meses de trabajar. Su esposos se desempeña en  mantenimiento eléctrico, sus mayor deseo es poder construir su casa ya que habita en casa de sus suegros, es por eso, que desea el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto  y poder tener privacidad y un comienzo, de tener su propia casa sola. Agradece a la institución por dar la oportunidad de salir con sus objetivos adelante. El cual es el deseo de muchas familias Nicaragüenses el poder tener una casa digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un cuarto

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vanesa González Martines tiene la edad de 30 años habita el barrio las enramadas, ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar siempre a sus hijos ya que en futuro quiere verlos como unos grandes profesionales , ya que se a esforzado mucho para darle lo que hoy ellos tienen , desde hace cuatro años trabaja como archivadora , ella esta contenta con el buena aprobación de su noveno préstamo ya que con este; comprara materiales de construcción para poner el piso de su casa con los créditos anteriores fue para construir su vivienda , agradece a la institución por dar la oportunidad de tener un mejor patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar piso para poner en la sala

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria Elsa C. García , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , uno de 13 y otro de 14 , los cuales trabajan  en la simbra unas horas por la mañana y luego al colegio , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle una mejor bienestar a su hijos , desde hace cuatro años se dedica ala actividad agrícola , inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , sus sueños es poder establecer una manzana de piña . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes y poder mejorar la simbra. Que espera vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Maria Elsa C. García, who is 37 years of age, lives in the Francia Number Two neighborhood with her husband, who works as a bricklayer and assists her with household expenses. They care for two children, one 13 years old and the other 14, who work for a few hours in the morning and then go to school. Their plans for their family include being able to improve their children's well-being. For four years they have been engaged in agriculture, starting the activity with their own efforts. They dream of establishing a pineapple field. The financing that they seek is for the purchase of raw materials and fertilizers to improve their crop sowing. They hope to sell the crop at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to improve crop planting

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan de la cruz C. P., tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras , ellos tienen nueve hijos , todos ya casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 30 años don Juan se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , ya que su mamá le dio tierras para que las trabajara y apoyara a su familia , él esta agradecido por la oportunidad que le hemos brindado durante nueve crédito ya que no solo ha mejorado sus cultivos si no también las condiciones de vida , ya que le ha permitido pagar en tiempo y formas sus préstamos a la vez le ha permitido que sus hijos trabajen con él. Con este préstamo comprara los insumos necesarios y poder aplicar al cultivo para lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan de la Cruz C. P. is 50 years-old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works as a fruit and vegetable merchant. Together they have nine children, who are all married and independent now. Juan's plan for his family is to improve their conditions of living. For 30 years Juan has worked in the farming business and his mother gave him lands for him to work and support his family. He is grateful for the opportunity we have given him with the nine loans he has received as they have not only allowed him to improve his crops but also his living conditions. His success with the loans has allowed him to pay on time and at the same time to work with his children. With this loan he will buy the supplies necessary to succeed in bringing in a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies and their application

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier V. , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio , San Ignacio , ubicado en La concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante , ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle mejores condiciones de vida  y poder establecer una pequeña pulpería para que su esposa trabaje desde el hogar ; a la vez estar velando por la educación de los pequeños , don Francisco desde hace veinte años , se dedica a la agricultura ya que con su propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno , agradece a la institución por apoyarlo durante nueve desembolsos ya que durante este tiempo a logrado establecer diversos cultivos . Con este último financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios y poder fumigar para quitar toda plaga y poder tener una buena cosecha.

loans.use: Comprar veneno y insumos para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Lucilo Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Lucilo Nicolás C. , tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el barrio Los M., ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos, ya todos son independiente, los planes hacia su familia es poder establecer un taller de soldadura para que uno de sus hijos lo trabaja y tenga mejor condiciones de vida, don Lucilo desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presento es no haber cancelado en tiempo y forma su crédito ya que la producción se atrasó un poco por la falta de insumo que requiere para obtener una  buena cosecha, agradece a la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado a pesar de las dificultades , con este sexto crédito va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo .
texts.en:
Mr. Lucilo Nicolás C. is 47 years old and lives in the Los Mariniz neighborhood of Ticuantepe. He and his wife work a business together. They have three children, all old enough to be on their own. They plan to open a welding shop that one of their sons could run in order to improve his livelihood. Mr. Lucilo has been farming for the past 30 years. His biggest setback was not having been able to discharge his loan in time because he fell behind in production a bit, due to lack of raw materials needed for a good harvest. He is thankful for the support he has gotten, despite his past difficulties. With this sixth loan, he will buy fertilizer and raw materials to apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and raw materials for crops

loans.name: Ana Yensi

texts.es: La Joven Ana Yensi González tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San Pedro ubicado en el Km. 16 ½ carreta hacia Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que ellos habitan donde su suegra , con el primer crédito logro comprar parte de materiales para iniciar a construir  su casa ya que su suegra les regalo un terreno donde ellos formen su hogar ,agradece a Afodenic por la confianza y el apoyo que le han brindado durante estos dos desembolsos , ya que son muchas la familias que se benefician con estos programas de desarrollo para las personas asalariadas que tienen el sueño de tener su casa. Comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar a construir.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo Alonso Gaitán tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada, para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo una hija la cual estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyarle a sus hija en sus estudios siempre y lograr construir su vivienda, don Ricardo desde hace siete años trabaja como bombero y se siente contento con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de Kiva ya que son  muchas las personas que logra poco a poco construir su casa , con este sexto préstamo va a construir las divisiones de su vivienda para poder tener mas privacidad ya que actualmente todo esta junto en el hogar.
texts.en:
Ricardo Alonso Gaitán, 36, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife. She does domestic work in a private house in order to help him with the household expenses. They have a daughter who is in primary school. The plans for the family are to always support their daughter in her education and to get to build a house. For seven years Ricardo has worked as a fireman. He is happy with the support that Afodenic offers through Kiva as there are a lot of people who, little by little, build their house. This is his sixth loan. He will use the loan to build divisions in his house to be able to have more privacy. Currently everything in the house is together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make divisions in his house

loans.name: Sabati Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatu M., Iye M. and Yakah M.. They are small-scale business people in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting loans of 1,000,000 SSL each. With the help of these loans, they will be able to expand their businesses, sell more, and improve their profits and, consequently, improve their living conditions.  

The leader of this group is Yakah M.. Yakah M. was born in Kabala about forty years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have eight children together. Two of Yakah’s children are in college, three are in secondary school, and three are in primary school. Yakah sells palm-oil, which is the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone, along with biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, milk, batteries, lollipops and much more. She has been in this business for four years.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Concepcion Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Concepción del Carmen B., tiene la edad de 45 años, habita  en el barrio San Antonio Sur, Ubicado hacia carretera Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como jardinero en un colegio infantil, ellos tiene un hijo a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Concepción desde hace trece años labora como empleada domestica , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para poder comprar materiales de construcción  de un sola vez , Agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación  de su primer crédito ya que se siente contenta por el financiamiento que se le da a las personas como ella ya que abecés por bajo salario no aplican en el financiamiento, con este comprara materiales de construcción y comenzara hacer las mejoras  a su vivienda

loans.use: Comprara materiales de construccion para mejoras a su casa

loans.name: Kankalay Iii Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatu A., Yangie K. and Kurta K.. They are small scale businesspeople in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. They called their group Kankalay III. They are requesting for a loan of Le 1,200,000 for each from Kiva Lenders to help them improve on the sizes and qualities of their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sale, better profit and consequently improving on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatu A. on the right. Fatu was born in Kabala and she is approximately forty-three years of age. She is married to a dealer in cigarettes and both of them have four children together. Two of their children are in colleges, one in secondary school and the other in primary school. Fatu sells rice, ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, beans and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been doing this business for five years now. Fatu will invest this loan into her business by buying more of the same goods to add to the ones she already has in her stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Good Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu B. and Chernor H. J. of the Good Sababu Group. They are local entrepreneurs in Kabala town, northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking for loans of Le 800,000 for each to enable them improve their businesses, make more sales and improve on the amount of profit they make. With the profit they will make, they will be able to better support their schools going children, feed them and meet most of their numerous household problems. 

Isatu B. on the left is the leader of the group. Isatu was born in Kabala town and she is forty years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have five children together. Isatu sells a number of items including cigarettes, matches, soaps, pastes, pens, milks, biscuits, gums, palm-oil and many more. Isatu has been a businesswoman for ten years, and thanks to SMT/Kiva loans, her business has experienced vast improvements over the years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here is M’Balu B., Fanta T. and Fatmata K.. They are small scale businesswomen in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group of three which they named Tamarameh II, in order to solicit a group loan of Le 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With this loan, they will be able to add value into their businesses, make more sales and earn more profit. Consequently, they will be in a better position to look after themselves and children. 

Their leader is M’Balu B.. M’Balu was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone but she now lives together with her husband and two children in Kabala town. M’Balu’s husband is a businessman and one of her children is in class III, the other is not of school going age. M’Balu is approximately twenty-eight years of age. She sells market food – pepper, groundnuts/peanuts and rice at Kabala main market. She has been in this business for more than five years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Here are staff members of an organisation in Kabala town, northern Sierra Leone. Though they receive salaries at the end of each month, they will still like to get a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects that they can not embark on with their bare salaries alone. Some of them will use the loan to buy a plot of land for the purpose of constructing a house in the future; some to pay school fees for their children; others to buy house furniture and others will invest theirs in a petty business. At the end of each month, their finance officer will deduct their repayment amounts out of their salaries and repays Kiva. 

Mohamed M. () is the leader of this group. He is born in a place called Wara Bafodia, which is about thirty-two miles away from Kabala town. He is now age 58, married to two wives and they have twelve children between the ages of one month – thirty years.  Mohamed has served his organisation for seventeen years. He will use this loan to meet his child’s college fees and other college charges.

loans.use: Pay college fees and other college expenses for his child

loans.name: Musidal Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Musidal II group. These are small scale businesspeople in the town of Kabala, in the Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of Le 800,000 for each to help them develop their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed J.. Mohamed was born in Kabala town, thirty-eight years ago. He is married with two children. Mohamed sells cattle and timbers. He has been in this business for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Thata

texts.en:
This is Thata M., a small scale businesswoman in the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Thata is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT in order to help her further strengthen her business.

Thata has, earlier on, received Kiva loans as a member of a solidarity group. With the help of those loans, she experienced a vast improvement in her business and personal life. She has been able to support her children in their education, feeding and well being; she has built herself a house with four bedrooms and a parlor and has solved many of her numerous household problems.

Thata is approximately fifty years old. She was born in Kabala town, married a lorry (truck) driver, and they have three children together. Thata sells rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnuts (peanuts). She has been a businesswoman for over twenty-five years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y 01 hijo, que aun están bajo su poder y depende de ella.Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Posteriormente con cuyas ganancias, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de zapatos y zapatillas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.Desde entonces, Angélica ha ido ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y supo salir adelante juntamente con su pareja.Angélica, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su tienda diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará papas, camotes, zanahorias,  cebollas, tomates y maíz morado en sacos.
