Once the plants are 30 centimeters high, he will transplant them into a clean field. This way, in a year’s time, it will be ready for him to pick. The sales are very profitable for him. That is why Daniel prefers to plant coffee. This is his third loan with MFP. With his previous loans he has demonstrated himself to be a very responsible client with his payments. He will use the money he is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña de 3 años. Su anhelo es de prosperar mediante sus cultivos, por ello madruga trabajando desde las 4 de la mañana hasta el medio día, sacando todos los arbustos de sus chacras de achotes y café. Él siembra estos dos productos porque le son muy rentables en distintas épocas del año; el café, en abril y mayo y los achotes, en setiembre. De ese modo guarda sus provisiones para el resto de los meses, siempre trabajando en común acuerdo con su esposa. Afortunadamente, cuenta con un comprador estable del café que produce, que es una de las empresas acopiadoras de su zona. Adicionalmente, Jaime fabrica zampoñas (instrumento musical de viento) de artesanía de diversos tamaños y los vende a los colegios y escuelas de su localidad, así obtiene ingresos adicionales para su hogar.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siendo un cliente muy responsable y ejerciendo el cargo de presidente de su banco comunal, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos y materiales para la elaboración de sus zampoñas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 8 hijos; de los cuales, uno de ellos aun vive con él y su esposa. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la siembra de frutas cítricas como la naranja, el tanhielo y tanyarina. Estos productos le han resultado ser muy rentables, sobre todo en los tiempos de verano cuando son muy demandados en la ciudad capital, Lima. Para ello prepara en cada viaje de 40 a 50 cajones y los vende desde 12 a 15 soles cada uno, así acumula muy buenas ganancias. Es por ello que para estos meses trata de tener bien cuidadas sus plantas cítricas, puesto que gracias a ellas pudo educar a sus numerosos hijos sin que les falte nada. Jorge se siente muy orgulloso de proveer sus mejores cítricos para la capital y ahora está planeando para el próximo año renovar sus plantas para que de ese modo sus cosechas no mengüen.
Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y a medida de sus préstamos consecutivos ha venido creciendo poco a poco con sus cultivos y eso le hace muy feliz. Con el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 1500 plantitas de cítricos, en aras de renovar dichos cultivos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 42, is married and has eight children. Only one child still lives with him and his wife. Since he was very little he has been planting citrus fruits like oranges, tangelos, and tangerines. These products are very profitable for him, especially in summer time when they are in great demand in the capital city of Lima. Therefore, for each trip he prepares 40 or 50 boxes to sell. He sells them for 12 to 15 soles per box. That is how he gets very good earnings. Thanks to that, he was able to educate all of his many children; they lacked nothing. Jorge feels very proud to provide the capital city with his best citrus fruit. He is now planning to revitalize his plants for next year so that his harvest does not diminish. This is his third loan with MFP. Through his consecutive loans his crops have been growing little by little. This makes him very happy. With the money he is now asking for he will buy 1,500 citrus plans in order to revitalize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Liana

texts.es:
Liana tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy responsable, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza, para ello prepara los alimentos de la familia desde muy temprano para después ir a ofrecer de casa en casa sus productos. Sus principales clientes son sus amistades y vecinos, pero constantemente está a la búsqueda de incrementar su clientela, pues entre más pedidos tiene sus ganancias aumentan. La parte más difícil de su trabajo son las cobranzas, pues algunas veces sus clientes no están en sus casas o demoran en pagarle, por ello debe ser insistente para recuperar su inversión. Durante estos años ha congeniado mucho con sus clientes, ya que gracias a ellos y a sus ventas ha sido premiada por ser la mejor consultora de belleza y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando en ello. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y durante los créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, es una eficiente y muy querida secretaria de la junta directiva de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita le servirá para incrementar su stock de productos, especialmente en perfumes, pues menciona que con estos productos obtiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Liana, age 28, is a very responsible woman. She lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children. For four years, she has been involved in selling beauty products. She prepares her family’s meals very early so that afterwards she can leave and offer her products door-to-door. Her principal customers are her friends and neighbors, but she is constantly seeking to increase her clientele since with more orders her profits increase. The most difficult part of her work is the collection of money because sometimes her customers are not home or delay paying her. That’s why she has to be persistent in order to recover her investment.

Over the years, she has gotten along very well with her customers since thanks to them and to her sales she has been an award winning beauty consultant, and that has motivated her to continue working at the job.

This is her third loan with MFP and during previous loans she has been very punctual with her payments. Also, she is an efficient and very well regarded secretary of the board of directors of her communal bank. The money which she is now applying for will be used for increasing her stock of products, especially perfumes, because she says that with these products she obtains better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es una mujer muy dinámica de 27 años, es madre de un hijo y está separada. Como sus padres son netamente agricultores, desde niña aprendió las técnicas de cómo cultivar cada uno de los productos. Es por ello que con mucha facilidad y sola, siembra café, maíz y fréjoles, sólo busca operarios para las temporadas de siega de los fréjoles, ya que cada  tres meses cosecha dicho producto, es por ello que le resulta mucho más rentable. Cuando comercializa sus frijoles logra obtener hasta 1500 soles, los cuales guarda para sus provisiones de tres meses mientras espera la próxima recolección de sus otros productos. Lucy se siente muy feliz de sostenerse mediante sus cultivos y sobre todo que a su hijo no le falte nada. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella menciona que se siente muy cómoda y acostumbrada  con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, además está muy agradecida por la confianza en la obtención de créditos consecutivos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus diversos cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a dynamic, 27 year-old woman who is separated and is the mother of a son. Since her parents are farmers, she learned the techniques of growing each one of their products when she was young. For this reason she is able to grow crops of coffee, rice and beans on her own, only using workers temporarily during the times of harvesting beans. Every three months she harvests her produce; this way it is much more profitable. When she sells her beans she is able to earn 1500 soles; this sum is used to pay for her supplies for three months while she waits for the next harvest of her other products. Lucy is happy that through her farming she is able to sustain herself and ensure that her son does not want for anything. This is her third loan with MFP; she mentions that she feels very comfortable and accustomed to all of the members of her communal bank. In addition, she is very grateful for the trust that she has been given in obtaining consecutive loans. The money that she requests now will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her diverse crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 49 años, está separada de su pareja, pero tiene 4 hijos con los que vive. Desde el momento de su separación tuvo que doblegar sus esfuerzos en sus cultivos, pese a eso sus frutos cítricos como la naranja y mandarina no le eran suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Entonces emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa de segundo uso, dedicándose a ofrecer de casa en casa de los pueblos rurales cercanos a su localidad, por lo que debe de trasladarse a pie durante varias horas. Esta actividad le ha resultado ser muy rentable, pero no por ello deja de cuidar sus sembríos, ya que en algunas fechas claves le generan ingresos satisfactorios. Por eso, Mary se siente muy feliz con ambas actividades, ya que mediante ellas a sus hijos no les falta nada.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos; asimismo, asiste a todas las reuniones programadas de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa, además de fertilizantes para sus plantas cítricas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería y compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer muy alegre de 38 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Desde su infancia se dedica al cultivo de plátanos; tal actividad la heredó de sus padres, de quienes también aprendió las tareas para el cuidado y limpieza de sus plantaciones. Nelly usa el guano de ave de corral para sus tierras, pues es muy efectivo y le permite un crecimiento uniforme de todos sus platanales. Cada fin de mes, comercializa su producto desde su misma chacra vendiendo por kilo, prefiere hacerlo así porque puede contralar mejor el peso, ya que las veces que ha vendido por arrobas (12 en 12 kilos), con mucha facilidad la engañan. Nelly se siente muy feliz de ser agricultura y más aun que mediante sus cultivos se genera muy buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal, porque aparte de los créditos puede tener sus ahorros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de guano de isla (de los gallinazos) y en la preparación de la chacra donde hará su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nelly is a cheerful, 38-year-old woman who lives with her partner and father of her three children, who live at home. Since childhood she has grown bananas, an activity she inherited from her parents, from whom she also learned how to care for and clean the plantations. Nelly uses the droppings of birds from the farm for the earth, because it is very effective and results in the uniform growth of all her fields. At the end of each month, she sells the product by the kilo out of her farmhouse. She prefers to sell this way because she can control the weight more easily; when she has sold by arrobas (12 in 12 kilos), she has been tricked easily. Nelly is very happy with her work as a farmer and even happier that her crops generate very good earnings to support her household. This is her third loan with MFP and she is pleased to belong to a communal bank, because in addition to loans, she can also keep her savings there. The money that she seeks now she plans to invest in the purchase of island guano (from vultures) and in the preparation of the farm where she will sow her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Nelyda

texts.es:
Nelyda tiene 37 años, es madre de 5 hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Desde niña se dedicó a las labores agrícolas, machete en mano quitaba fácilmente todos los arbustos de las chacras de sus padres. Ahora, junto a su esposo trabajaban en común acuerdo para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Ellos siembran plátanos y paltas; resultándoles más rentable el plátano, porque cada 15 días lo venden desde su misma chacra a los diversos compradores que los buscan ahí. Estas ganancias les permitieron ahorrar y con ello, hace 6  meses, lograron instalar un espacio en su casa para la venta de golosinas y bebidas. Desde entonces los trabajadores del aserradero que se encuentra al costado de su vivienda son sus principales consumidores, quienes constantemente le compran sus gaseosas y galletas. Por ello, Nelyda se siente muy motivada en incrementar los productos que ofrece en su pequeña tienda.
En su tercer crédito con MFP, del que se siente muy agradecida por las facilidades brindadas, así mismo se compromete con todas las actividades que organiza su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más bebidas gaseosas y también fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y mercadería para su tienda

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años se dedica al cultivo de frijoles, maíz y café; actividad que le agrada mucho realizar, pues desde pequeño aprendió las tareas agrícolas. Con respecto al fréjol, este producto le permite acumular dinero cada tres meses y sus cosechas las comercializa en el mercado de su ciudad. A pesar de que no encuentre un buen precio, logra obtener lo necesario para sostener las necesidades de su familia mientras espera los meses de bonanza, que son durante la recolección y venta del café. En estos meses toda su familia se alegra muchísimo y juntos trabajan en la faena de recolección, para abastecer a una de las acopiadoras de su zona, que es su comprador regular, pues le paga un buen precio por su café.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrando ser un cliente muy responsable, sobre todo muy comprometido en las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de guano isla (de los gallinazos) para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 33 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of his two children, in their own home. For the past 13 years, he has dedicated himself to the cultivation of beans, corn and coffee. He finds this profession very satisfying, since he learned how to work on a farm when he was just a small child. The beans allow him to earn money every three months, when he sells his harvest at his city's local market. Although the prices for this product are not very high, he is able to obtain the necessary basics to satisfy his family's needs while they wait for the "bonanza" months, which are when the family harvests and sells their coffee. During these months, the entire family is extremely happy; they work together on the labor of collecting the coffee beans and delivering them to one of the suppliers in the area, which serves as their regular buyer since it pays them a good price for their coffee. This is Rodrigo's third loan with MFP, and during all of this time, he has shown himself to be a very responsible client. Above all, he is very active in the meetings of his communal bank. The funds he is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of island guano (from turkey vultures) to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Mohammad Taqi Group

texts.en:
This is M. T. group and Fatima is the group leader of the group. The group is made up of three members and each of them would like to expand and progress their business. They have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Fatima is a tailor. She wants a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine because she has lots of problems with her old one.

Faranaz is a tailor and also is wonderful at knitting. She would like a loan to purchase the required materials in order to do good work.

Azatullah wants a loan for his car to buy a new machine for it.

They are all thankful to both AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Senen

texts.en:
Senen M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 61 years old. Senen is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Senen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Senen has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Senen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Senen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Senen is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Senen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian L. is from the village of Biasong. He is 24 years old. Ian is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ian owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ian has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Ian is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ian from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Abdul Hadi Group

texts.en:
Abdul Hadi is the group leader of Abdul Hadi group. There are four members in this group. All of the group members requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. Abdul Hadi and M. Ferzoz want to take a loan for their retail shops to complete their stocks. Zarmina wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Shekiba wants to receive a loan for carpet weaving business to purchase good quality materials. 
They are all glad from this process.

loans.use: Completing their requirements

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Y. is from the village of Barra Puntod. She is 42 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Susan is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean H. is from the village of Unidos. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2000, Mary Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mehnaz Hamidi Group

texts.en:
Mehnaz is the group leader of Mehnaz Hamidi group. There are four members in this group all of them would like to progress their businesses, so they all have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. Mehnaz wants to take a loan for his brother’s tire repair shop. Mari wants to take a loan for his son who sells second hand clothes. Roya wants to take a loan for his brother’s fruit cart. Momtaz wants to receive a loan for his husband’s fruit shop. They both have share business. Momtaz cleans and packages the fruits and her husband sells in the shop.  
They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: progressing their businesses

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
Marie Fe is from the village of Biasong. She is 31 years old. Marie Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marie Fe owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Marie Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marie Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marie Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Marie Fe is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marie Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur N. is 21 years old. In spite of the fact that he does not yet have his own family, he is supporting his parents.

Teymur sells different kinds of foodstuffs and has been in this business already for four years. This activity generates the main income for the family.

As long as Teymur is very popular in the market by selling fresh and tasty pastries, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, he requests 1607 AZN to increase the variety of goods that he sells.

With your help, Teymur will be able to make his business succeed and, in the nearest future, to have his own family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Khasbat

texts.en:
Khasbat B. is 56 years old and is married with five children.

Khasbat has been running her own small business for seven years already. She has a place in the local market for selling products such as macaroni, sweets (candies), tea, sugar, and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 8:00 p.m. Her husband and son help her in the store, registering the stock and serving the clients. Khasbat and her son are very friendly and polite, which allows them to keep their clientele.

Now, Khasbat is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her stock. She thanks everybody who has decided to support her.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en:
Qalib R. is married and has one son who is the meaning of his life. Qalib is honest, hard-working, very creative and full of new ideas. He was always dreaming about starting his own business in a trade. However, he didn’t have sufficient capital and he realized he had to provide for his family and cover household expenses. That is why he opened a grocery store.

Qalib is requesting a loan to increase the range of his goods. This loan will give him a chance to buy a larger assortment of goods such as sugar, flour, vegetable oil, cereals, and many others. He believes the loan will boost his economic activity and help him generate more profits. It will not only help him grow his business but also give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he sells

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq A. is a successful businessman selling foodstuffs at a market in Agsu, Azerbaijan. He started his business about thirteen years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy.

Mushviq purchases products at very low prices and then resells at a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. He rents a very good location for his business, and he has little competition. He has requested a loan of 1607 AZN to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profits and continue operating a profitable business.

loans.use: To increase his business capital

loans.name: Anver

texts.en:
Anver H. is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling foodstuffs and detergents thirteen years ago, as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in growing his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products he offers his clients.

Anver is now married and has two children. This is his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business. To cover current demand from his clients, Anver is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN.

With your help, Anver will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Mi Corason De Grand Bassin Group

texts.en:
“Mi Corason De Grand Bassin”, which is actually Spanish for “My Heart” of Grand Bassin”, is a loan group made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. The group has a wide range of businesses ranging from phone cards and repairs, to used clothing to peanut sales. Lazar R. is one of three representatives of the group. He is 23 years old, single, and has no children.

Lazar has been in business for some years and now sells phone cards for all of the major phone companies in the country. He has also created a relationship with another business that repairs phones and they have created a referral system for each other.

Lazar looks forward to being able to build his business in order to be better able to support his family. On behalf of Lazard, Mi Corason De Grand Bassin, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy in bulk more phone cards of various types

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (pollos y gallinas) y recientemente, desde hace 6 meses, tiene ganado vacuno. Todos los días cuida y alimenta a sus animales, ordeña a sus vacas y la leche que extrae la vende, siendo ésta, un ingreso económico más para su hogar. Paralelamente a esta actividad, Claudia también siembra papa y maíz, cuya cosecha la vende al por mayor a los comerciantes del mercado de su ciudad. Estas actividades le sirven para sostener su casa y su deseo a futuro es tener más cabezas de ganado e implementar un establo grande y de mejor infraestructura.
Es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy activa en su banco comunal y su deseo es seguir participando en su grupo de forma solidaria y responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono para la siembra de alfalfa que será el alimento para sus animales; también adquirirá semillas de papa y más pollos para su granja.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 25 años y actualmente vive en una casa arrendada. Hace 6 meses decidió dedicarse al comercio de alfalfa a gran escala, anteriormente vendía productos alimenticios, pero no tenía buenas ganancias; por ello, aprovechó los ahorros que tenía para arrendar varios terrenos de cultivo y dar un cambio de rubro a su actividad económica.
Ahora extrae la alfalfa que produce y la transporta en camión a sus clientes, que son comerciantes minoristas de alfalfa. Este trabajo es de todos los días y ella misma se encarga de  la repartición, pero para la cosecha sí necesita contratar personas que la ayuden, debido a la gran extensión de sus cultivos. Este negocio le está resultando muy rentable, por lo que Elba desea continuar con esta actividad y empezar a ahorrar para comprar sus propios terrenos para asegurarse, a futuro, mayores ganancias.
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, en sus créditos anteriores ha demostrado con su puntualidad su responsabilidad y en esta oportunidad  no será diferente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el alquiler de más extensiones de tierra para el cultivo de alfalfa.

loans.use: Alquiler de más terrenos de cultivo

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Ella tiene una carpintería donde realiza todo tipo de muebles y mangos para herramientas de trabajo para los agricultores, como los picos y las palas. Hubo una época en que  la venta de estos mangos decreció y esa fue la oportunidad para que empezara con el diseño y fabricación de muebles económicos y a la vez durables, los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes, quienes son especialmente los comerciantes de muebles de su localidad y de la ciudad capital, Lima. Para el futuro, Elena desea crecer más en su negocio e implementar su taller con mejores equipos e instrumentos.
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona que promueve la unidad en su banco comunal y por su buen carácter es muy apreciada en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la implementación de su taller, instalando electricidad industrial, es decir la trifásica.
texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old, and lives with her husband in her own house. She has a carpenter’s workshop where she builds all types of furniture and handles for agricultural work tools, such as picks and shovels. There was a time when the sale of these handles declined, and she took this opportunity to begin designing and building inexpensive furniture that was also durable; this furniture is now in high demand by her clients, who are the furniture merchants of her locality in the capital city of Lima. In the future, Elena would like for her business to continue growing, and to set up a workshop with better tools and equipment.

This is the second opportunity she has had to get a loan through MFP; she is a person that promotes unity in her Communal Bank and because of her good character she is highly valued by her group. The money that she is requesting will be used to work on her workshop by installing industrial electricity, that is to say, three-phased electric power.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing electricity in her carpenter’s workshop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace 5 años viene ejerciendo la agricultura, sembrando principalmente papa y en ocasiones maíz. Durante las época de siembra y cosecha toda su familia participa en las tareas y de es necesario contrata a peones. Una vez cosechados sus productos los vende en el mercado local, donde ella misma se encarga de comercializarlos para tener mayores ganancias. Esta actividad permite a Gladys estar en su casa y atender a sus hijos, además que es una fuente de ingresos económicos muy importante para su familia, aparte del aporte de su esposo. Para más adelante, Gladys desea mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas y que su producción sea más abundante. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas ganas de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, siendo responsable y puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para preparar la siembra de sus próximos cultivos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. For the past 5 years she has been working in agriculture planting mainly potatoes, and on occasion corn. During the planting and harvest her entire family participates in the work chores, and when necessary she hires laborers. Once harvested her products are sold at the local market, where she is in charge of selling her harvest to earn the best possible profits. This business allows Gladys to be at home and attend to her children, and it also provides a source of income that is very important to her family, aside from her husband’s contribution. In the future, Gladys would like to improve the quality of her harvest and that her production becomes more abundant.

This is the second time that she is acquiring a loan through MFP, for which she has a great drive to continue working in her Communal Bank, and to continue being responsible and punctual in her payments. On this occasion, the money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to prepare her crop for the following harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 7 años y 5 meses en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de artículos variados para el hogar, los cuales lleva en camión a los pueblos de la zona rural, que es donde nació.  María adquiere su mercadería al por mayor y de esa manera la puede vender a precios al alcance de sus clientes, su esposo es quien viaja con mayor frecuencia, generalmente los días jueves de cada semana, y regresa los fines de semana para adquirir más mercadería de acuerdo a la situación y demanda. Es por ello que hace poco empezó a vender colchones, pues María está siempre alerta ante cualquier cambio que mejore su negocio.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad  en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos y muy participativa en todas las actividades programadas por su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la comprara más mercadería, en esta oportunidad en artefactos eléctricos pequeños, como planchas, licuadoras y radios.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Merida

texts.es:
Mérida vive con su esposo y sus hijos  en una casa alquilada. Hace 6 meses decidió iniciar un negocio D. venta D. ropa D. segundo uso, la cual adquiere en la ciudad capital (Lima) y en otras ocasiones en su misma ciudad. Mérida sale todas la mañanas para ofrecer sus prendas, las cuales tienen muy buen aspecto y están en óptimas condiciones, lo cual le que permiten una venta segura, ya que las ofrece a precios muy bajos. Para ella es muy gratificante ver que tienen buenas ganancias y pueD. trabajar junto a su esposo, quien la ayuda con la compra D. la mercadería, por tal motivo Mérida trabajará arduamente para incrementar su capital y obtener mejores ganancias para su familia.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona puntual en sus pagos y digna D. confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita estará destinado a la compra D. más ropa D. segundo uso, en grandes cantidades, para que pueda asegurarse mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Merida lives with her husband and children in a rented house. 6 months ago she decided to start a business in the sale of second-hand clothing, which she acquires in the capital (Lima), and on other occasions in her own city. Merida leaves every morning to sell her clothing that is appealing and in optimal conditions, which secures her sales given that she offers them at very low prices. For Merida it is very gratifying to make good profits and she can also work with her husband who helps her purchase merchandise, because of this Merida will work arduously to increase her work capital and to obtain better earnings for her family.

This is the third opportunity that she has been able to acquire a loan through MFP; during this time she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments and a trustworthy person. The money that she is currently requesting will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing in large quantities to ensure higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (second-hand clothing).

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es soltero, tiene 32 años y actualmente vive con su madre. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta productos agrícolas, desde pequeño aprendió las labores de la agricultura y ahora lo hace independientemente. Pero, él no sólo vende sus productos luego de cosecharlos, sino que también les da a sus clientes un valor agregado, pues dependiendo del producto, los limpia y pela o pica. Por ello, obtiene mayores ganancias en el momento de su comercialización, además la mayoría de sus clientes son de otras ciudades y de empresas de alimentos. Ricardo reparte su producto en su movilidad propia que es su motocarro, siendo su deseo a futuro, tener más terrenos de cultivo y una piscigranja de truchas. 
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, el es parte de un banco comunal y además de ser muy entusiasta, es puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar arveja.
texts.en:
Ricardo is single, 32 years old, and currently lives with his mother. He works harvesting and selling agricultural products. Since he was a small child he learned how to carry out agricultural work and now works independently. However, he does not just sell his products after harvesting, but rather he also adds value to them by, depending on the product, cleaning, pealing, and cutting them. For this work, he earns better profits; the majority of his clients are from other cities and from the food industry. Ricardo sells his products from his own mobile motorcar, hoping that in the future he will have more land to cultivate and a trout farm (aquaculture).

This is his third time acquiring a loan through MFP; he is a member of a Communal Bank and in addition to being very enthusiastic, he is punctual in his payments. The money that he is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and planting peas.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en sus propios carros, cubriendo rutas locales. Su esposo es uno de los conductores y ambos han notado que con esta actividad logran obtener mejores ganancias que con la agricultura que era la actividad que anteriormente desempeñaban. Y aunque este trabajo no tiene días de descanso, tiene una buena recompensa, que son las ganancias, por esta razón, Zenaida desea mejorar sus autos para seguir brindando este servicio, y para un futuro cercano tener la posibilidad de comprar otro carro.
Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy activa en su banco comunal y lo demuestra con su disposición para ejercer uno de los cargos de la junta directiva de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una póliza de seguro contra accidentes de tránsito para una de sus movilidades, documento indispensable para seguir brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros local.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 46, lives with her husband and their children in her own house. For two years she has been covering local routes and transporting passengers in her own cars. Her husband is one of the drivers, and they both have noticed that they have obtained better earnings than in their previous activity, agriculture. Even though there are no days off in this work, it has good compensation, the earnings. For this reason Zenaida wishes to improve her cars in order to continue offering this service. In the near future she would like to buy another car. This is her third loan with MFP. She is a very active member of her communal bank. She shows this by being part of the executive board. The money she is now asking for is to buy an accident insurance policy for one of her cars. This is an indispensable document in order to continue offering local passenger transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accident insurance

loans.name: Magadalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 37 años, es una madre muy admirada por sus vecinos, ya que trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Con mucho sacrificio Magdalena pudo instalar una tienda de abarrotes, la cual con el pasar del tiempo ha ido creciendo y haciéndose muy conocida, pues gracias a su carisma y alegría a logrado tener muchos clientes, los cuales prefieren comprarle a ella ya que saben que ahí encontraran todo lo que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Magdalena con MFP y está muy contenta de la oportunidad de crédito. Sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su bodega.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 27 años, es una madre muy joven y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Antony de 8 y Jaison de 6, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
El trabajo que realiza es la confección textil, trabaja con lana de alpaca y vicuña haciendo bonitas alfombras, tapetes, adornos para sala, etc., los que posteriormente lleva a vender de forma ambulatoria a la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca); pero los textiles más bonitos los manda a Lima para que sean vendidos a un mejor precio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es diseñar los modelos de los textiles, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar sola, ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagar a un ayudante. Para el futuro anhela tener una empresa textil bien conformada, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el primer préstamo de Marisol con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fibra de alpaca y vicuña para realizar sus textiles.

loans.use: Compra de fibra de alpaca y vicuña

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y persistente, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Su salón de belleza es uno de los más visitados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella tiene un talento natural para cortar el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual la buscan sus clientes, es por los novedoso cambios de look que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuáles son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirlo en el mejor de la ciudad.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Nelly con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de productos de belleza

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 26 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Aunque es muy joven todavía, Olinda sabe que ya es hora de ganar su propio dinero y salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda satisfacer la demanda de productos de sus vecinos. Su tienda está bien surtida debido a la buena ubicación que tiene, motivo por el cual los productos que tiene se venden muy rápido.
Lo que más le gusta a Olinda de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Olinda con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas; en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y así tendrá un mejor stock para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Olinda is a very happy 26 year old young woman. She lives in her own house with her family. What she wants most is to succeed in life. Even though she is still very young, Olinda knows that now is the time to earn her own money and get ahead. That is why she decided to set up a grocery store. She can satisfy her neighbors' demand for products with the store. Her store is well stocked due to the good location she has. That is why the products she has sell very rapidly. What Olinda likes the most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for three years. She considers the most difficult part to be having to stay all day inside the store without being able to leave. She hopes that her store grows in the future and brings better income. This is Olinda’s fourth loan with MFP. She does not expect to fail to make her payments. In her communal bank she is a very involved and supportive member. She will use the 700 PEN she is asking for to buy more products for her grocery store. That way she will have better stock to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 24 años, es una joven madre de familia. Actualmente vive en la casa de su hermana junto a su esposo Javier de 25 años y su menor hijo, Yovani de 5 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. En el Centro Educativo “Escuela de Chóferes“ de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Rosa y gracias a que ganó la licitación para poder vender dentro de la escuela ha podido mejorar su situación económica, su kiosco es muy concurrido por los niños, quienes la prefieren por la variedad de golosinas que vende.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que simultáneamente puede cuidar a su hijo, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su kiosco, aun así sabe que tiene estar ahí para vender más. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosa con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario al resto de los integrantes de su grupo. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para su kiosco y así incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and a young mother. She currently lives in her sister’s house with her husband Javier, who is 24 years old, and their young child Yovani, who is 5 years old. She is willing to work very hard in order to see her family succeed. At a driving school in the city of Juliaca, Rosa manages a kiosk where she sells candy. Thanks to the bid she won to sell candy near the school, she has been able to improve her financial situation. Children keep her kiosk very busy since they prefer the variety of candy that she sells.

What Rosa enjoys most about her job is the ability to work and care for her child at the same time. She has been in business for 2 years and the most difficult part is spending all day at her kiosk, yet she knows she has to be there in order to make more sales. In the future, she hopes to open a grocery store so that she can improve her quality of life.

This is Rosa’s fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to access credit. Rosa is admired within her Communal Bank and she is willing to provide all the necessary assistance to the other members of her group. With the loan of 600 soles that she requested, she will purchase more candy for her kiosk to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more candy to increase her inventory

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 38 años, está casada, vive su esposo y sus 6 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde niña anhelaba tener una tienda y hace 6 meses logró implementar su bodega en un espacio de su casa,  pero ella siente que es más útil en los trabajos agrícolas por muy pesados que sean, los cuales realiza junto a su esposo. Pero por ello no deja de abrir a las 6 de la mañana su establecimiento y atiende a sus clientes alegremente hasta las 9 de la mañana, que es cuando se dirige a sus chacras y cuando llegan sus hijos del colegio atienden la tienda por las tardes. Alejandrina nota que poco a poco viene ganando más clientela, pues donde se encuentra ubicada no tiene competencia, por ello tiene en mente surtir su bodega hasta que tenga gran variedad de productos y así sea más atractiva para sus vecinos.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y ella se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal, así como en el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos comestibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in their own home. Since she was a girl, she longed to have her own store; six months ago, she succeeded in establishing a grocery store in a space in her house. Still, she feels that the agricultural jobs she works on with her husband are more useful, even though they can be very difficult. Because she must tend her farms in the morning, she is unable to open her business at 6 a.m. and cheerfully attend to her clientele until 9 a.m. Her children help tend the store when they return home from school in the afternoons. Alejandrina notes that she is winning over more clientele little by little; where she is located, she has no competition. She would like to stock her store with a large variety of products and by doing so become more attractive to her neighbors. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP and she feels very devoted to her communal bank with respect to making punctual loan payments. With the funds she is seeking, she will buy more food products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 22 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hijo, la casa que habitan actualmente es una que le dieron a cuidar a su esposo. Desde muy pequeña se dedica a las labores agrícolas y ahora, en compañía de su esposo, ha sembrado papas, ollucos y oca; pero lo que más rentable le resulta es la papa. Para Angélica dedicarse a su chacra es de gran satisfacción, pues no lo hace sólo por una necesidad económica, a pesar que ahora con su hijo pequeño en la espalda no logra trabajar ágilmente, igualmente se esfuerza por hacerlo, teniendo mucho cuidado con su pequeño. Angélica suele vender todas sus cosechas en el mercado más importante de la ciudad y hasta el momento las ganancias obtenidas logran sustentar las necesidades de la familia.
Este es su primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir cada una de sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que viene solicitando será para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emiliano tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 5 hijos, en su casa propia. Él es campesino desde niño, desde entonces su cultivo preferido es la papa, porque genera mayores ingresos, por ello posó orgullosamente para la foto en su chacra de papa. Emiliano trabaja con el apoyo valioso de su esposa, sobre todo durante las cosechas, ya que para esas faenas se requiere de muchas manos para la recolección del producto. Sus labores agrícolas le gustan mucho, aunque sean de mucha inversión y de pesado trabajo físico, eso no le ha quitado la alegría ni las esperanzas de seguir sembrando papa, ya que las veces que la comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, logra solventar todos los gastos de su hogar. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, siendo una persona muy puntual en sus cuotas, asimismo es muy colaborador en las actividades de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para su próxima siembra de papa, la cual será dentro de muy pocos días.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 31 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hijo. Ella es una mujer entregada a las labores agrícolas y se siente muy a gusto de trabajar en cada uno de sus cultivos bajo el liderazgo de su esposo. En esta época han sembrado grandes extensiones de papa y arveja, de las cuales la más rentable es la papa, ya que la vende tanto para consumo y como semilla en una sola cosecha. Para el caso de las papas de consumo las envía directamente al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, el más importante de su región, donde en promedio, demora memos de media hora en terminar de vender la camionada de papas. Por otro lado, las papas como semilla las guarda en su depósito hasta que lleguen los compradores de la costa hasta su chacra, quienes les compran por kilos y a un buen precio. Es por ello que Gladys quiere comprar más chacras, de ese modo evitar arriendar algunas tierras y el pago que debe hacer por ellas.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y se siente muy bien con todos sus compañeros, pues todos la han acogido muy bien, a pesar de haberse incorporado posteriormente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Gladis is 31 years old and she lives with her husband, the father of her son. She works in agriculture and really likes working with each of her crops, with the leadership of her husband. This season they have planted a large area with potatoes and beans. The potatoes are more profitable, since they can sell them as food and as seed tubers from the same harvest. In the case of food potatoes, she sends them directly to the wholesale market in the city, the most important one in the region. On average, it takes less than half an hour to finish selling a truckload of potatoes. As for the potatoes for seed tuber, she keeps them in storage until buyers from the coast come to her fields. They buy the potatoes by the kilo, and at a good price. This is why Gladys wants to buy more fields, so she can avoid having to pay to rent them. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is part of a communal bank and she gets on well with the other members because they have all been very welcoming toward her, even though she joined after the rest. She plans to use the money she is requesting to buy chemical fertilizers for her next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre soltera de 37 años, tiene 2 hijos pequeños y vive en compañía de su madre. Con el anhelo de brindar una vida saludable a sus hijos, se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y posteriormente ir a pastar a sus 120 carneros. A María le agrada mucho cuidar de sus animales, pues cada 15 días los compradores la visitan en su misma casa para escoger los de mejor tamaño y peso. De esta manera, ella se evita la tarea de matarlos y ofrecer su carne en diversos lugares de su localidad. Adicionalmente, en los meses de octubre a noviembre, siembra papas y arvejas, asimismo; y en de mayo a junio está evocada a la cosechas de dichos cultivos, los cuales comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, mientras su madre la ayuda cuidando sus carneros.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, ella siempre hace todo lo posible por pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, pues no quiere quedar mal con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, al que dice estimar muchísimo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de medicinas para desparasitar a sus ovejas, así como para adquirir fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.

loans.use: Medicina para sus animales

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 55 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos aun vive con él y su esposa en su casa. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura y esta actividad lo llena de mucha alegría y satisfacción, en especial cuando sus cultivos lucen como se muestra en la foto. Por ello, muy entusiasmado Pedro nos contó sobre el resultado de abonar y fumigar sus plantas para que estén saludables. Esto le da la esperanza de que sus cosechas serán exitosas y abundantes, y por ende, muy rentables. Pedro comercializa sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, que es donde todos los agricultores de las zonas rurales llevan sus productos, por ser éste el nexo a los mercados de la capital (Lima), y sobre todo porque rápidamente puede obtener el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Pedro estuvo un tiempo retirado de su banco comunal, pero esta vez retorna con la oportunidad de un nuevo crédito que impulse el crecimiento de sus cultivos, por lo que se compromete a no defraudar la confianza de todo el grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus próximas siembras en terrenos temporales (según la lluvia).

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es un carismático joven de 32 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Él aprendió desde pequeños las labores agrícolas, por lo que actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papas, habas y arvejas. Y debido a su experiencia, conoce de los altibajos de los precios en el mercado, por esa razón, siembra de manera intercalada sus tres productos, ya sea que uno de ellos tenga bajo precio, lo podrá cubrir con las ganancias del otro. Con esta dinámica de trabajo llevan más de 10 años y le ha dado buenos resultados, por ello alegremente trabaja en compañía de su esposa, ya que el éxito de sus cosechas dependen de la atención a sus cultivos.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrando ser un cliente muy responsable y a la vez acomedido en las diversos eventos que realiza su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hija, en su casa propia. Cuando la visitamos la encontramos en los ajetreos de tapar apresuradamente la pachamanca (plato típico que consiste en la cocción de los alimentos en un horno bajo tierra). Esta actividad suele realizar en cada cosecha de papas para compartir con sus peones y asimismo celebrar la buena producción de sus chacras. Rosmery se siente feliz de su actividad agrícola, ya que desde niña realiza tal labor, por ello no le parece pesado, su dificultad es cuando hay lluvia excesiva, pues este clima atrae a las plagas y a los gusanos, que con mucha facilidad perjudican sus sembrios. En el caso de los gusanos los contrarresta con la compra de fungicidas, pero hay plagas que no puede controlar y eso la apena muchísimo porque pierde sus cosechas.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ella ha venido cumpliendo la labor de secretaria de su banco comunal eficientemente, por lo que los demás integrantes le tienen mucho cariño. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Dolly Grace

texts.en:
Dolly Grace T., having repaid her first requested loan from ASHI, is requesting a much larger amount. The new loan will be a great opportunity for her to grow her business that she started through her previous loan. It will also enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

The profits that her business will be making as it grows will be used to satisfy her wish to build a concrete house that will secure her five children (aged from three to ten years old) from any forms of disaster, especially a typhoon. Most especially, through the income of her business, her husband’s income will be augmented and will enable her to provide for the needs of her children, especially food.

Dolly Grace also hopes that her business profit will enable her to sustain the education of her children until college so that they will have more options in choosing their own career paths.

loans.use: To buy eggs and rice to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: After being so upset with her two eldest children who did not pursue their education until college, Emerita G. who is a mother of three children whose age range is from 17 to 29 learned to accept her failure in life. She can not blame her children for such default because their life being poor has m made that circumstance to happen. Instead of getting herself stuck in bitterness, she decided to have her own business which is bamboo buy and sell to be able to augment the income of her husband being a laborer. Profits she will be getting through her business will be used to sustain the education of her youngest child who will be going to college until she graduates. Emerita also wants her business to grown further so that she can be of help to her grandson who lives with her and to her two unemployed children. She wished that she can still make their lives better through her business and with the loans she can request in the next cycles (increasing amount of loan after the other).

loans.use: Will be used to pey for purchasing bamboo (used for manufacturing house furniture, and material for housing) for selling.

loans.name: 02.07.1.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thường Ðoàn Thị (23) is a 46 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thường is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.07.1.6 Nam Ngạn (02.07.1.6 Nam Ngạn).


Thường is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thường owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Thường has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Thường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thường has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used for the same purpose.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trang T. Thị (24) is a 19 year-old female who is requesting a 3,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


2.  Vui N. Thị (25) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Mạnh Lê Thị (26) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Khoun

texts.en:
Y. is a 56-year-old married woman and mother. To earn a living, Y. and her husband plant various crops on their own farmland located next to their house. They grow cabbage, morning glory and rice, which they propose to sell to buyers when the crops are matured. The family has been farming since 1991 and typically earns $3 in income a day. 

This couple has been blessed with two children: one is married and the other one is single and works in a garment factory. Y. decided to seek a loan to buy more farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds to support their business.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Colita

texts.en: Colita H. is from the village of Mantic Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Colita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Colita owns & operates a business operating a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Colita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Colita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Colita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Colita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 31 years old, is currently the good mother caring for a lovely young child. She is married to Sophea, age 32, a local fisherman. Seng S. owns a small store where she cooks and sells some foods to people who need those foods to eat with wine or beer. She normally generates around of US$5 per day which she uses those incomes to better meet her family’s financial crisis. To help reduce the cost of hiring taxi, Seng S. has decided to request a loan to purchase a motorbike which she will use them to pick up her essential ingredients supply for her investment. With the remainder of the loan she will increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike which she will use them to pick up her essential ingredients supply for her investment

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar T. is 39 years old and resides with her husband and her children in the Takeo province. Together with her husband are local teachers at state school. They typically make a combine around US$4 of profit every day. This couple has two children who are at school. To earn an additional profit, Sar T. is asking for a loan of US$600 to raise pigs and purchase the feed for them as well. This will help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song S., 41, is a farm worker who lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She has been farming since 1989 to earn a living and is able to make US $2 every day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. He typically makes US $3 per day. This couple has three children living at home to support.

Song has an idea to earn more profit to help raise her standard of living. She would like to take out a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a stock of rice. She needs to take off the husk, with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mr. Vin Y. is 60 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. He is married to Mrs. Mao Rith (shown in the picture), age 60, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This older couple has given birth to three children who are married and have already started new homes. One of them is a garment worker, while the others are also running a farming business. Because the farming business is the main source of income and a profitable one for the family, Vin Y. would like a loan of US$1000 from Kiva through HKL to be used to buy more farming supplies to grow his crops. In addition, he will use some of the loan to provide a small loan to his villagers with specific schedule repayments.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies to grow his crops

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem N., 31, lives with her husband and two children in the Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a professional at decorations and handicrafts. Since 2007, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes to earn a living and typically make US$3 each day. Decorative dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and their price is expensive, too. Most people prefer hand-made to machine-made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business as she is not yet married. Hem N. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase more silk for decorating.

loans.use: To purchase more silk for decorating

loans.name: Suk

texts.en: Suk W., 49, pictured here with her granddaughter, is married and lives in the Takeo province with her three children. One of her children is married but still lives with her. Suk works as a farmer and is able to make US$1 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and typically makes US$3 every day. She has seen an opportunity to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to raise ducks and chickens for eggs.

loans.use: To raise chickens for eggs.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad B. is from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Caridad owns and operates a tailoring business, providing women's tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be her 9th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun S., 42, is a widower with three children and lives in Takeo province. All of his children are in school.

Hun S. is a local doctor who is able to make US$5 per day. He would like to take out a loan of US$500 he needs to purchase medicines and equipment for his practice.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Nenencia

texts.en: Nenencia D. C. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Nenencia operates a business selling ice cream in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nenencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental.
