Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat C., 25, lives with her husband and young child in the Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 2000, she been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$4 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive, too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Khat C. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase more silk for decorate.

loans.use: To purchase more silk for decorate.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 27, lives with her husband and young child in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer who is able to make less than US$1 each day. Pen was not available for the photo and so her husband is shown instead.

Pen is a professional who decorates women’s dresses. Since 2003, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically make US$3 each day. Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear them during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year.

It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so they are expensive. Most of the people prefer hand-made rather than machine made designs. Pen said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has operated her business since before she was married.

To earn an additional profit, Pen has requested a loan of US$500 to raise ducks for eggs.

loans.use: To raise ducks for eggs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma O. is an independent woman who is 56 years old. She lost her husband a long time ago and all of her children are working in Manila and have their own families now.

Aside from her intention of having the opportunity to obtain a loan to be able to put up a business, Norma joined ASHI in 2008 because she wanted to meet a lot of people, make friends, and be able to belong to the association of women that has a common goal in life, which is to rise above poverty. Her capacity and courage in running a business all by herself was inspired by her fellow women in ASHI.

After having started her small business through a loan she had requested, now Norma is requesting a much larger loan which will enable her to grow her motorcycle-for-hire business. With the amount she is requesting she plans to purchase a sidecar to be attached to her motorcycle to make it a tricycle-for-hire business.

For Norma, her business is her life, and the loan she obtains is her source of life. This has been her support to be able to buy her food and live independently. She wants her children not to be bothered about her and she wants to live her live productively by helping her children and grandchildren someday.

loans.use: To buy sidecar for her motorcycle

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal S., 32, lives with her husband and three young children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is a carpenter who is able to make around US$4 each day. Phal was not available for the photo and so her husband is shown instead.

Phal S. is a professional decorator of women’s dresses. Since 2000, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$4 each day. A decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year.

It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so it is expensive. Most of the people prefer hand-made designs rather than machine-made. Phal S. said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has operated her business since before she was married.

Phal S. would like a loan of US$700 to purchase wood and other material to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials to expand her husband’s business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth B. is from the city of Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is 33 years old. Maribeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maribeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en: Roeung T., 44, lives in the capital of Phnom Pen, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows variety kinds of crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of four teenage children; two of whom are internal sewing staff for a garment industry. While her husband is a local fish catcher. This family has been facing very difficulties with sanitation for along time, because their house doesn't have a toilet for a hygiene. To help provide the healthy family, Roeung T. would like a loan of US$500 to buy material and to hire a constructional builder in order to build a new toilet.

loans.use: To buy material and to hire a constructional builder in order to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Along with her husband who is a fisherman and their five children ages 5 to 17, Mary Ann B., 44 years of age, lives in a town surrounded by plains covered in rice fields, enveloped by the crystal water of the sea that meets the foot of the mountains with wide tree plantations. Every morning, Mary Ann’s husband used to go fishing, while Mary Ann was left at home attending to the needs of their children and making herself busy doing household chores. When their children were still young, Mary Ann was content to only perform this role. However, now that all of their children are studying, she realizes that she has to exercise an economic role to augment the income of her husband. Therefore, in 2008 she joined ASHI and requested a loan which she used for starting up her own business. She bought cattle to fatten. After two loans, she realized that her profit from cattle fattening is double the capital, once it is sold after six months. Resources in their surroundings, especially during this season of rain, can provide enough food for the cattle she is raising. Now, she is requesting a much larger loan to buy more cattle for raising and to be able to increase her profit as well. In her business lies her capacity to send all of her children to college to better their future.

loans.use: To pay for cattle for a cattle fattening business

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im T., 47, pictured here with her sister, is a widow with one child lives with her sister in the Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$6 each day, while her sister is a worker. She makes about US$3 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Im T. is asking for a loan of US$500 to diversify her grocery items to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: Expand grocery items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. has been a member of ASHI for the past years. Business she supported with the loan she gets through ASHI all throughout her membership was managed by her husband. Because of the increasing expense of her family, Josephine is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which she will going to use in growing her fishing business. Through loan she is requesting she plans to purchase instruments and gadgets for fishing as well as repairing their fishing boat.    

Josephine’s fishing business is her family’s cup of tea and bread. Her dream of sending all her six children ages from five to 21 years old to college until graduation relies on the profit her business will be making.  Her hope of upgrading her family lifestyle anchors on the stability of her business. Above everything else, Josephine’s happiness and contentment in life being a mother and a wife depends on the success of her business.

loans.use: Will be used to spend for the fishing boat repair and for purchasing gadgets and gears for fishing.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum T. is 28 years old and resides with his wife and four young children in the Takeo province. Since 2007, he has been performing as a musician to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 each day, while his wife makes and sells cake, making approximately US$5 per day as well. Two of the children are in school and two others are too young to attend. Chum Thom is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase musical instruments.

loans.use: Musical instruments.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: The person appears in the picture here is Mrs. 58 years old Thy K. and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she has owned a plot of land that inherited from her grandfather since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of seven children: one is married and live away from the family home, two are garment workers, and other four also take a farming business. Thy K. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is Thy K.'s main source of income to sustain her family. She is applying for a loan to buy other farming supply which she will use to greatly grow crop on her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy other farming supply which she will use to greatly grow on her own farmland

loans.name: Gnet

texts.en:
Gnet S., 51, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Gnet S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a water pump. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.
(Gnet's husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 28 years of age and she is married to Melanio, who works as a tricycle driver in their village. Her family are happily living within the village of San Fabian Echague. The couple is blessed with three children. The eldest is Christian-9 years old who is elementary pupil; Melanie-8 years old, elementary pupil and the youngest is Melody-7 years old.
	Jenalyn's husband is a tricycle operator within their village. She would like to change those old sprockets of her tricycle to avoid any unnecessary things to happen during the daily routine of her husband. For this reason, she would like to request a loan to the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000. This could really helpful in their family needs most especially to her three children who are studying now.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of motorcycle

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a vendor of cosmetic products within her village. She is 46 years old, yet still business minded. She is married to Ronnie, who is a mechanic. This couple is striving hard to improve their way of living.
 
Vivian is thankful because she has a responsible husband who fully supports her business. She hopes that she can maintain her business. Though they don’t still have their siblings, they still work hard for the purpose of their security when they get weak. Vivian and Ronnie are living in the village of San Fabian Echague. She would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders to further improve her vending business. Vivian is selling her products house to house to earn money for their daily expenses in life. Sacrifice and patience are Vivian's guiding principles in managing a small business. She said that things will turn into reality if you have enough capital to roll. In this regard, Vivian would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 PHP. This could be a big help in her business development.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Mrs. Susana P., operates a typical village store for almost 3 months, she's been very patient in dealing her business, because she wants to increase her income to support her family's needs,her weekly net income is PHP 500.00, and she has planned to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders an amount of PHP 6,000.00, to purchase some grocery items and some beverages to sell in her sari- sari store. She hopes that her loan request will be granted in due time, as much as possible.
She is married to Mr. Alfredo P., a farmer. They have 2 children namely; Darwin- 30 years of age, a businessman, and Ma. Theresa- 28 years old, college graduate. They are residing at baranggay San Francisco Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area, one of their source of income is farming. She said that "never get tired of doing good things for others, because in the end you may get unexpectedly what you wish for"

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna G., 33 years of age, has operated a junk shop for almost one year. Her weekly net income is 2,200 PHP. She plans to avail of a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of 4,000 PHP for her additional requirements, and she hopes to become productive in due time to support her family in their needs. 

She is married to Mr. Renato G., a farmer, and has been blessed with 3 children: Jonathan, 10 years old and in grade 5; followed by Renato Jr., 8 years old and in grade 3; and their youngest, John Rey, 5 years old. They are residing at baranggay San Francisco, Isabela. Their house is located near the rice farm and fish ponds. She hopes that her loan will be granted as soon as possible. She believes that "prayer changes everything; just have faith in him."

loans.use: Additional capital for her junk-shop business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Perseverance and humility are the guiding principles of Luz O.. She manages a store within the village of San Fabian Echague. According to her, expanding her store is what she wants to happen to be able to achieve success in life and business.

Luz is married to Noel who is the driver of a passenger van. They are thankful because they have two children who are their helpers in managing their store.

Luz would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further improve her sari-sari store. She hopes that she will be able to budget the loan amount she is requesting so that she can purchase additional groceries for her store. She hopes that she and her husband will be able to sustain their children’s needs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica- 28 years of age, she is married to Mr. Melchor B., who is a driver, they are blessed with 2 children namely; Melvin- 8 years old, grade 2 in primary level, and Ma. Monica- 6 years of age, grade 1. They are presently residing at baranggay San Francisco, Alicia Isabela, a rural and plain area, approximately 4 kilometers away from the national highway.She manages a poultry business (cobb-raising) for almost 3 years, her net income is PHP 2,000.00 when she disposed after 15 days. She plans to avail a loan amount of PHP 4,000.00 for starting capital. She hopes that Kiva will grant her loan immediately. She's been blessed with productive business, because of that she is thankful to those people who support and helped her.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her poultry business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en: Yolita, 46 years old and married to Fernando, manages a sari-sari store within the village of San Fabian Echague.  Improving and expanding her store to  improve their standard of living is Yolita's goal, so she is requesting a loan of PHP5000 to purchase additional groceries to generate a bigger income. Yolita hopes for the success of her store in order to save for their security when they are elderly.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy Y., (age 46) and her husband, Mr. Sros Soeung, (age 48), live in a Phnom Penh suburb and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and other two assist their parents in farming. 

Chanthy sells dessert at her house in the village. Besides of the business, she also helps her husband in watermelon farm. By the way, Chanthy doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for traveling costs very often which are expensive for the family. Therefore, she is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a direct-seller of cosmetics products within the village of San Fabian Echague. She is thankful because she has two children: Jefferson - 4 years old and Janice - 3 years old.

Marilyn would like to purchase additional products due to the many orders given to her by her customers. Accordingly, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes that this loan she is requesting will be granted.

Marilyn is hoping and praying that she will be able to improve their way of living through the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich H., 59, has a business selling banana ice-cream. Living in Takeo, he is able to make US$21 in revenue each day. His wife, Keo ChH., 59, is a rice farmer and also raising pigs. On average, she makes US$1 each day. This couple has five children; four of them are in school. Pich H. is requesting a loan of US$1000 purchasing pigs and the feed for them.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Nil

texts.en: Nil C., 65, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Takeo province. Since 1993, he has been running a motor-taxi business to earn a living, making about $5 each day. His wife is a farmer who works for less than $1 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to rise dramatically. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these conditions, Nil  is asking for a loan of $1000 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. With the new motorbike, Nil will be able to earn more money to raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.
